loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Elena es una comercianta del municipio de condega a unos 35 km al orte de la Ciudad de Esteli en el Norte de Nicaragua, ella esta felizmente casada y su esposo es un obrero que se dedic a alas labores de construccion, tiene dos hijos que estudian uno en secundaria y el oto en primaria, cabe mencionar que esta señora junto a su esposo asumen los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
La señora Marita Elena tiene un pequeño negocio donde se dedica a la venta de ropa variada de niños adultos para damas y caballeros asi como vende tambien mercaderia de aseo personal (javon, shampoo, gel para cabello, cremas,ect) ella tiene unos 19 años de dedicarce a este negocio y ella ofreces sus productos en comunidades aledañas al Municpio de Condega.
Esta señora se presenta por segunda vez a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar su segundo credito y asi poder seguir rutiendo su negocio y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas con un inventario mas surtido, ella se muestra positiva de que dicho credito le sera aprobado y asi poder ir mejorando su negocio y por ende tener unmejor ingreso familiar lo que ira cambiando si forma de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza Elena is a merchant in the Condega municipality, which is 35 kilometers north of the city of Esteli in the northern part of Nicaragua.  She is happily married, and her husband is a construction worker.  She has two children.  One is in secondary school, and the other attends primary school.  It is worth mentioning that she and her husband assume the school expenses for their children.

Marita Elena has a small business where she sells various clothing for children and adults.  She also sells personal hygiene merchandise (soap, shampoo, hair gel, and creams, etc.).  She has been in this business for 19 years.  She sells her products in the communities surrounding the Condega municipality.

This lady has come to the CEPRODEL offices for the second time to request her second loan.  This way she will be able to continue stocking her business.  She will also be able to increase her sales with a better stocked inventory.  She is confident her loan will be approved.  This way she will be able to improve her business in order to have better family income.  This will change her way of life.

loans.use: to buy varied clothing and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro comes from a line of Tlaxcalan dairy farmers, but with the poor returns on milk right now, he is feeling the pressure to modernize his facilities. Animal feed and energy input costs increase every year - acquiring his own biodigester is a practical solution. 

Pedro is investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to improve his farm's competitiveness because it will allow him to convert cow manure into potent biofertilizer and methane-rich, renewable biogas. These products will allow him to replace the expensive and damaging fossil-fuel based agrochemical fertilizers and liquefied petroleum gas he currently purchases, reducing his costs while reducing his farm's impact on the environment. 

This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to pay for a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: La Verite Group

texts.fr: La cliente Makoma est conseillère du groupe communautaire de crédit « La verite»,jeune entrepreneur, expérimentée, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un couturier modéliste. La cliente est vendeuse des farines de Manioc. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt agricole  et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a environ 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente de farine. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter 3 sac de farine de Manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise,scolariser, nourrir et construire une maison pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Makoma is the advisor of the borrowing group La Verite ("the truth"). She is a young entrepreneur, experienced, 35 years old and the mother of 5 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a tailor. 

Makoma is a seller of manioc flour. She sets up her wares in a farm store and sometimes from her home. She began her business with her own funds received from her husband. Later, she received a loan from the microfinance organization Hekima. She has been in the flour selling business for around 4 years.

This new loan will allow Makoma to purchase 3 bags of manioc flour. With this, she hopes to grow her business, provide schooling and food for her children, and build a house. In closing, she is extremely thankful to Hekima for their support of small businesses via microcredit.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of manioc flour

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a businesswoman that lives in Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga. She is 55 years old, married, and has 3 adult children. 

Teresita has a shop that sells assorted groceries, feed, varieties of rice, etc. She has had this business for over 10 years. She has been earning 8,000 PHP per month. Teresita has requested a new loan to purchase one unit of multicab to be used for her business. 

Teresita has been a Paglaum MPC member since 2007.

loans.use: To acquire a one unit multicab.

loans.name: Coleen Jill

texts.en:
Coleen Jill is single, with no children.   She is 34 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, the Philippines.

Coleen Jill  is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed, brooders and heat lamps, livestock medicators, and hog-watering systems.

Coleen Jill has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Coleen Jill hopes to provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed, brooders and heat lamps, livestock medicators, and hog-watering systems for raising pigs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 57 years old and lives in Catagan, Tangub City. Fe is married with 3 children.

Fe has a farm and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 6 months. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla, age 70, is from Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, in the Philippines. She is married, raising four children.  

PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to producing good pigs, in order to sell them continuously. 

Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed.  Now, she requests a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy additional feed. 

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband.  Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to keep sanitary conditions more easily.

loans.use: to buy feed and another piglet

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita, age 71, is happy tending her little store. She is married, with three kids, and her husband is a farmer. 

The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. Jovita keeps on running the store well even though other stores give her increased competition. Jovita believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain her store and beat the competition.  

Jovita has reached her fifth year as a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. 

She has confidence that she can maintain her label as a  member in good standing. She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store and, from it, earn the best education she can afford for her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

location.town: SINDANGAN - LAGAG, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 44 years old and lives in Polao, Tangub City.  She is married, with four children. 

Flordeliza has a "sari-sari" store and earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to restock her store with canned goods, soft drinks, noodles and other items. 

Flordeliza has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, and other items

location.town: Tangub-P-7 Polao Tangub City  Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is married, with four children.  She is 57 years old and lives in Tinacla-an,Clarin, in the Philippines.

Mely is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for eight years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals, such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides, and ovicides.

Mely has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Mely hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio began his business, Peralez Trucking and Construction, eight months ago just outside the Brownsville, Texas, area.  

Ever since he could work, Patricio always worked for his father, transporting rock, dirt, concrete and other building materials to work sites where his father installs septic tanks. But this familiar business wasn’t just a job to him; it provided a living.

In early 2013, Patricio’s father helped him purchase a truck to help with the hauling. As his father saw the entrepreneurial spirit in his son, he passed the truck ownership to Patricio to form his own trucking and construction business.

The money Patricio saved from working with his father wasn’t enough to maintain the truck, keep the tank full, properly operate his business and purchase what he needs before bidding on projects. 

Seeing his struggle, his sister, a current Accion Texas Inc. borrower, recommended that Patricio visit the nonprofit microlender to inquire about applying for a loan. After Patricio applied and received approval, he quickly used the money for start-up and fuel costs, and regular maintenance for his truck. The Accion loan allowed Patricio to further his trucking and construction business and be competitive in his field. He is also now able to compete for larger projects in the Rio Grande Valley area.

As Patricio continues to bid for local work, he’s planning his next goal, which is to hire subcontractors to assist with the workload.

loans.use: to pay start-up and fuel costs, and provide regular maintenance for his truck.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
Cherilyn is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with six children. She lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. 

Cherilyn has a business in snack vending. She has been in this activity for more than five years and earns a monthly income of PHP 3,600. 

Cherilyn has requested a new loan to be used to pay her son's tuition fee. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since 2007.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Lirika

texts.en:
Nikolla is an Egyptian Albanian and the father of six children. He repairs shoes. His wife Lirika, who is not in the picture because she felt uncomfortable being photographed, is requesting a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to fix a collapsed wall in their home and to use the rest of the loan for Nikolla’s little shoe repair business. They are indeed poor according to VFA’s poverty measurement tools and they try very hard to earn a bit of money for themselves.
 
“We are retirees now and we sometimes need medications and our pension is not enough. It is approximately $100/month for both [of us], when the price of medication is so very high. But anyhow, what else can we rather do than trying. People in the villages around need my services, thank God,” Nikolla said.

loans.use: To fix a collapsed wall in their home and use the rest of the loan for her husband's little shoe repair services.

loans.name: Mykhailo

texts.en:
Mykailo is married. He runs a small business selling fruits and vegetables at the local grocery market. Mykailo has been in this business for 15 years. He buys groceries in bulk and then sells them at retail.

Mykailo always has high quality vegetables, good prices and discounts for repeat clients, which he has many.

Mykailo is asking for 15,000 UAH in order to purchase potatoes, onions and carrots. He hopes to sell them and make some profit to support his family - a wife and two daughters. Mykailo has a dream to open a small grocery store and have better conditions to serve his clients.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zoilo Adalverto

texts.es:
Don Zoilo Adalverto es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un señor de 64 años que creció en una familia humilde de campo donde la actividad principal de ellos era la agricultura y ganadería. Desde hace 27 años don Zoilo se dedica a elaborar ladrillos y tejas es una actividad que aprendió de su padre, el cual es un material que los Nicaragüenses utilizan para la construcción de viviendas. Este material es a base de tierra la cual la meten en un horno a temperatura alta para solidificarlo luego lo ponen a la venta.
Su día inicia a las cuatro de la mañana en la elaboración de ladrillos y tejas, cuenta con tres trabajadores los que unos hacen el material y otros lo meten al horno.
Don Zoilo tiene muchos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que le ha brindado Kiva en estos largos años con los cuales construyó un nuevo horno para elaborar un producto de mejor calidad.
En la actualidad está solicitando un crédito para la compra de leña y pago de mano de obra con el fin de no tener escases de este material y su actividad no se detenga y también para no fallar en el pago de sus trabajadores que es su principal mano de obra.
texts.en:
Zoilo Adalverto is originally from the town of El Sauce.  He is a 64 year old man who grew up in a humble country family whose principle activity was agriculture and raising livestock.  From 17 years of age Zoilo has worked making bricks and tiles and it is a job he learned from his father.  These bricks and tiles are used by Nicaraguans for their homes.  This material is made out of earth and is baked in a very hot oven in order to harden it and then put it up for sale.  His day begins at 4am making bricks and tiles. He has three workers who help, some who make the material and others who bake it in the oven.  

Zoilo has worked with the Kiva partner Ceprodel for many years and he feels very grateful for the support that he has received from Kiva over these many years. It has helped him build a new oven and make a higher quality product. 

Currently he is requesting a loan in order to purchase firewood and to pay for labor with the aim of not running out of material so that his business doesn't slow down and also in order to not miss paying his employees as they are key for their manual labor.

loans.use: To purchase wood and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Hayanist village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two sons. She has worked in the local school as a secretary for many years. However, the school salary is so low that she can hardly meet the ends of everyday life. To be able to earn a living, the family has a livestock of hens, and they now want to purchase some pigs for the livestock.

Gohar hopes for the good wishes of the lenders in order to receive a loan of USD 1200.  Gohar had previously taken a loan from a local financial institution but unfortunately was not able to pay it back because her family faced hard times. However, because of the hard work Gohar and her family were able to work in a sustainable enough way to cover their monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products, so lenders will greatly support Gohar and her family by giving her an opportunity to purchase pigs to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for pigs

loans.name: Yerazik

texts.en: Yerazik is from Kapan town where she lives with her son. The only source of the family's income is the livestock of pigs ad piglets that Yerazik breeds.  Yerazik's son serves in the army and unfortunately is not able to help his mother in earning the family's living. To be able to keep on breeding the livestock the family needs to purchase three more pigs as well as some forage for them. A loan of USD 2500 will help Yerazik to keep the livestock and to be able to meet her daily costs. She ask for the lenders support in collecting the money, which will help them to maintain the only source of their income.

loans.use: to pay for three pigs and forage.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is a young woman from Goris city in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two little children. She is currently engaged in agriculture, which is an important source of income for the family. Meri's husband helps her to sell the agricultural products she gets from the farm in the local market. It is very hard for the family to meet their basic needs in today’s difficult social conditions. Meri is now seeking for some financial resources to maintain the livestock and specifically wants to purchase 12 piglets as well as forage for feeding the livestock. The family hopes for the lenders support in gathering the needed loan of USD 2500, which will be a great help to the young agronomist and her family in sustaining their business.

loans.use: to pay for 12 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Yerazik

texts.en:
Yerazik is a young woman from Ditak village in Ararat region. She has been involved in agriculture for 5 years. Particularly, Yerazik keeps 12 chickens and 50 turkeys, as well as cultivates different types of fruits and vegetables, including tomatoes, peppers, peaches, apricots, and cherries. Yerazik lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and three grown children. The whole family helps Yerazik with the farming business as it helps them to gather income and cover their basic costs. 
Now, this hard working mother with many years of experience in the agricultural field asks for a loan of 3000 USD. 
The loan is important for Yerazik to renovate the greenhouse, purchase fertilizer, and cover cultivation costs. This will greatly assist Yerazik and her family as they will be able to gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse, purchase fertilizer, and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alicia is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Alicia has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her computer units.

Alicia has been in this business for 7 years. Alicia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of the computer units at her internet cafe

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria works hard to support her family. Apolinaria is married and has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines.

Apolinaria requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

Apolinaria has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Apolinaria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 55 years old and widowed with four children. With two children currently in school, Aurora works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Aurora has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, noodles, snack foods, cooking oil, coffee, etc. 

Aurora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay has been engaged in agriculture for five years. He keeps cows and cultivates land. Currently Nikolay cultivates greens, cabbage, tomato and different types of fruit trees (apricot, peach, cherry, nut, apple and pear). The gathered harvest is sold locally and thus Nikolay gathers the income, which is vital for sustaining his family. He lives with his parents, wife and two children (ages 11 and 6).

Now, this hardworking farmer with good credit history behind him asks a loan. He needs this loan to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This loan is very important for Nikolay in order for him to be able to increase the income from agriculture and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida works hard to support her family. Bienvenida is married and has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines.

Bienvenida requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers.

Bienvenida has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Bienvenida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 62 years old and married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Carmelita has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.   She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 25 years.   She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary was born in 1985. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Deiralla. Her husband is a government employee. 

Mary has been working in raising livestock and selling them for one year. She started her project with buying a small amount of livestock. Then she started to sell their products, which made her project profitable. 

Now she is planning to raise her income and productivity to support her husband financially. In order to do that, she needs a youth loan to buy more livestock and thus raise her productivity.

loans.use: To buy more livestock and raise her productivity

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman was born in 1983. She is married and has five children. Her husband works for a governmental entity. Because Iman is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to appear in the picture instead of her. 

Iman has been working in her minimarket for four years. She started this project with a small quantity of money. Then she started to expand it gradually. 

Iman would like to expand her project more so she can start earning better income in order to help her husband in covering their children needs. To do that, she has applied for this youth loan to buy more foodstuffs and merchandise, which she doesn't have enough money for.

loans.use: To buy more food products for her store

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen was born in 1987. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a governmental entity and at the same time works in agriculture. Because Nisreen is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture.

Nisreen has been working with her husband in agriculture for a year. They started their project with planting a few flowers. But unfortunately the flowers withered because of the seasonal weather change. So she is planning to start her project of agriculture again and expanding it in the future by buying a land tractor and increasing the space of her planting land.  She hopes that will increase her productivity and earn a better income that will help her support her husband in covering their children needs. 

Now she needs seeds to plant them, in addition to farm supplies. But she doesn’t have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy seeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Maeesha

texts.en: Maeesha was born in 1960. She is married and has six children, one of whom works in agriculture. Her husband is a governmental employee. Maeesha has been working selling clothes and blankets for one year. She started her project selling them at home. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of clothes and blankets in order to raise her sales and earn a better income which will help her assist her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes and blankets

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Les 10 femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont mariées à moitié polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Benzana dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, de bois de chauffe et de charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Satou (1ère femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de d’oignon, 2 paniers de tomates, un sac d’ail, et une grande quantité de d’huile chez son fournisseur à Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Satou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en: The 10 members of the Benkadi group are married women, half of them living in polygamous families. On the average, they are 42 years of age, with six children. They all live in the village of Benzana in Segou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other as neighbors and relatives as well as through their business activities in the village. They work as vendors selling condiments, firewood and charcoal. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan cycle. Mrs. Satou (the first women standing from left to right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy five bags of onions, two baskets of tomatoes, a bag of garlic, and a large quantity of vegetable oil from her supplier in Segou. She sells for cash and on credit out of her home and on the street, to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Satou hopes to achieve an average monthly revenue of 20,000 West African francs, which will be used to provide for some of her children’s needs and build up her working capital.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is 42 years old and married with three children. Gabriela works very hard to provide for her two children who are still in school.

Gabriela runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of shampoo, toothpaste, sugar, milk, soft drinks, biscuits, etc..

Gabriela has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Gabriela would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shampoo, toothpaste, sugar, milk, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Roem

texts.en:
Roem, 43, is widowed with five children and resides in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. To support the family, she has been farming pineapple trees for 13 years. Her current business earns about 20,000 KHR per day to support the family’s needs. 

Roem has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely paid back her loans from VisionFund and has successfully used the loans to better support her family. She is now applying for another loan of 1,200,000 KHR to buy more pineapples plants. She hopes to grow more pineapples to increase her family’s income for a better living.

loans.use: To buy more pineapples plants.

loans.name: Khy's Group

texts.en:
Khy, 40, is married with four children and resides in a rural village located in the Battambang Province’s Thmor Koul district in Cambodia. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last ten years, she has been farming rice as the primary source of her family’s income. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day from her current business. 

Khy is leading her group to ask for a loan. Khy is going to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Nakry's Group

texts.en:
Nakry is 48 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang Province’s Moung Russey district and earns a living by selling Khmer noodle soup and snacks in the village. She and her husband have been in this business for ten years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR 50,000 per day from their current business.

This is Nakry’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Nakry will use her portion to buy spices for her Khmer noodle soup. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy spices for her Khmer noodle soup.

loans.name: Ma. Elma

texts.en:
Ma. Elma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Ma. Elma has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for seven years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1975. She is married and has three children. Her husband is retired and has his own laundry. Her brother is in the military. Maha has been helping her husband at his laundry for five years. He started his business with a small amount of money. Then he started expanding and attracting more customers as it’s the only laundry in their area. 

Maha is planning to help her husband expand their store to improve their living conditions by earning a better income. In order to be more productive and expand the business, they need a new ironing machine and a new washing machine. She plans to invest in these machines with the loan money. Because Maha is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy new ironing and washing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter.

loans.name: Filemón Antonio

texts.es:
Condega un municipio conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora, vive el señor Filemón en una comunidad aledaña con su esposa y su hijo al que tiene la obligación de mantener y darles sus estudios , de profesión, agricultor, en granos básicos maíz y frijoles y la ganadería en pequeña escala.

Conocido como una persona honesta y trabajadora, tiene 08 años de experiencia y trabajar estos rubros, trabaja junto con su familia en su pequeña finca de tres manzanas  que es alta mente productiva y quiere sacarle un buen provecho explotándola en uno de los mejores rubros de la zona como es el ganado, recientemente visito la oficinas y  está solicitando un crédito, para la compra de una vaquilla de vientre donde piensa salir beneficiado y mejorar su hato ganadero ,su prioridad es pagar el crédito con los ingresos obtenidos de la cosecha agrícola de maíz y frijol que obtiene en cada ciclo agrícola, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que es su principal meta futura.
texts.en:
Felimón lives with his wife and son in a community that borders Condega, a municipality known for its pottery artisans, handicrafts and hard-working people. He is responsible for supporting his wife and son, and for providing for his son’s education. Felimón farms basic grains such as corn and beans and raises livestock on a small scale.

Felimón is known for being honest and hard-working. He has eight years of experience in agriculture. He works together with his family on his small five-acre farm. Felimón says that the land is very productive, and that he would like to use it for cattle. He says cattle raising is one of the strongest farming activities in the area. 

Felimón is requesting this loan to buy a heifer for breeding to improve his herd. He says his priority is to pay off the loan with the income he earns every growing season from his harvests of corn and beans. Felimón says the loan will allow him to keep working to improve his family’s living conditions, which is his principal goal for the future.

loans.use: To buy a heifer for breeding to improve his herd.

loans.name: Samy's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Banteay Meanchey Province’s Mongkul Borey district, Samy is 32 years old and married with four children. All of her children are still in school. She earns a living by raising chickens. To supplement the family’s income, she and her husband work as a paid workers. Together, they can earn about KHR28,000 per day from their business and can save about KHR 15,000 each day for their future needs. 

This is the third loan for Samy’s group of two. They both successfully repaid their previous loans from VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Samy wants to use her portion to buy more chicks to raise. She hopes to feed her chickens so they grow to be fat and healthy. Then she can sell them for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to raise.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en:
Sony, 31, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham Province’s Tbaung Khmum District. She is a married mother of four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Her family’s income comes from growing cassava on five hectares. To complement their income, she also sells grocery items. From her current business, she can earn about KHR50,000 per day and manages to save about KHR24,000 per day for their future needs. 

Sony has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely repaid her first loan. With the loan from VisionFund, she improved her living conditions. Now applying for another loan, she is going to buy fertilizers for her cultivated land. With this loan, she hopes to expand her farmland so as to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her cultivated land.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham Province’s Prey Chhor District, Nan is 35 years old and married. She has two dependent children who are in school. The main source of her family’s income comes from farming rice. Her husband is a construction worker. Having been in these businesses for several years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR36,000 to support her family. She can save about KHR15,000 per day for their future needs. 

This is her first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of KHR3,200,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa was born in 1983. She is married and has 1 son. Her husband is a pharmacist. Fedaa has been working in selling clothes for 2 years. She started her project by selling clothes at home. Then she started expanding it until she opened her own store. Fedaa is planning to expand her store more in the future, but right now she needs to buy new merchandise for which she doesn't have enough money. For that reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothing merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Al-Rwan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rwan and consists of 4 ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. 

Fatima is 30 years old and lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is an individual who possesses many values such as sincerity and honesty. Those who know her say that she is a friendly person and works very hard at her job. She is a tailor who has gained the respect of her neighbors and family members. She started her business tailoring dressess, skirts, etc., then selling them to customers. She is hardworking and through effort and dedication has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. She is requesting this loan to buy fabrics and sewing materials to complete orders for her customers. She hopes to expand her business to own a sewing store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing materials to complete orders for her customers.

loans.name: Benito Javier

texts.es:
El señor Benito Javier  posee un negocio de venta de CD de música y películas, en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace diez  años para  el sustento de su familia, se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a las 8:00 am finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para la compra al por mayor de mercadería como: CD de música, películas y juegos para Nintendo Play Station el cual le permitirá obtener mayores  ingresos económicos mejorando la calidad de vida de él y toda su familia.
texts.en: Benito Javier has a business selling music CDs and movies in one of the markets in the city of Leon. He has been working in this busines for ten years in order to support his family.  He goes to his stall at 6:00 am, opens his business at 8:00 am, and finishes at 5:30 pm from Monday to Saturday, and at noon on Sunday.  The loan that he is requesting through Ceprodel will be used to buy wholesale merchandise such as: music CDs, movies and Nintendo PlayStation games, which will allow him to earn more income and improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy music CDs, PlayStation games and DVD movies.

loans.name: Juan Roberto

texts.es:
El socio sigue dedicandose a estudiar la carrera prefesional de psicologia ,el socio desea poder seguir estudiando para de esta forma ser un buen profesional en el futuro,el socio es una persona responsable y alegre ,el socio desea poder terminar rapido su carrera y poder trabajar en una buena empresa.


El socio solicita el credito para pagar sus estudios universitarios.


El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to study for a professional degree in Psychology.  He wants to continue studying so that he can become a successful professional in the future.  The borrower is a responsible and cheerful individual.  He wants to finish his degree quickly so that he can work for a good company.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for his university studies.  He is grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to pay for his university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en: Kefah was born in 1970. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. Kefah has been working in her beauty salon for one month. She took the idea of her project from working previously at another beauty salon. Now she is planning to expand her project by buying makeup and machines, but she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she requested this loan. Kefah decided to appear in the picture with her friend Bushra who is helping her at the salon.

loans.use: To buy machines and makeup to expand her beauty salon

loans.name: María Isidora

texts.es: María es una señora  como muchos deseos de superación y con mucho optimismo en cuanto al desarrollo académico ,actualmente es casada, y trabaja como conserje en el MINED de esta comunidad con 10 años de experiencia, Una de las necesidades que la señora  María   es de compra equipos de albañilería tales como soldador y metabo ya que su esposo es albañil y trabaja para la alcaldía de la localidad, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar en la compra de equipos de albañilería como soldador y metabo, lo que vendría a incrementar sus ingresos en seno familiar
texts.en: Maria is a woman with a great desire to succeed and with a great deal of optimism with respect to her academic development. Presently she is married and has worked as a caretaker for the MINED [Ministry of Education] in her community for 10 years. One of Maria's needs is to buy construction equipment such as a soldering iron and welding machine, since her husband is a construction worker and works at the region's town hall. Since she has this need, she has made a sound decidion in coming to CEPRODEL to seek a loan to purchase this construction equipment, i.e. a soldering iron and welder, which would contribute to increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to buy construction equipment, a soldering iron and welding machine.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
La señora María Antonia posee un negocio de venta de Granos Básicos en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace quince  años para ayudar a su esposo en el sustento de su familia. 

La señora María Antonia se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7:00 am finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para la compra al por mayor de mercadería tal como es: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, cosméticos y especies con el obtendrá mayores ganancias, aumentara su inventario y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Antonia has a business selling basic goods in one of the markets in the city of León. She has worked at this business for fifteen years in order to help her husband support their family.

María Antonia goes to her sales stall at 6:00 a.m. and opens at 7:00 a.m.; she finishes at 5:30 p.m. Monday through Saturday, and at noon on Sundays. 

The loan that she requested from CEPRODEL will be used to buy wholesale merchandise such as: rice, beans, sugar, oil, cosmetics, and spices, with which she will obtain better earnings and increase her inventory and her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, corn, oil, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Guillermina Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina Mercedes  posee un negocio de venta de productos comidas, en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace veinte y un  años para  el sustento de su familia ya que es una madre soltera de dos hijos. 

La señora Guillermina Mercedes se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7 am,  finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar de mercadería al por mayor, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, carnes de res y de pollo, especies con el cual podrá obtener mayores  ganancias  las que le ayudara  a aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Guillermina Mercedes has a business selling food products in one of the markets in the city of León. She has been working in this business for twenty-one years to support her family, as she is a single mother of two children.

She gets to her work area at 6:00 am and opens her business at 7:00 am, finishing up at 5:30 pm from Monday to Saturday and at noon on Sundays.

The loan that she is seeking from Ceprodel will by used to buy goods in bulk, such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, beef and chicken. With these goods she will be able to get a better return which will help her to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, oil, beef and pork.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер энергичный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Алишер поступил в Таджикский Государственный Национальный Университет по специальности экономиста. Алишер любит читать книги и заниматься спортом. Он надеется, что в университете он будет учиться отлично. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Alisher is a dynamic young man.  He is 18 years old, not married yet, and he lives with his parents.  This past year, he successfully graduated from high school and was accepted to the Tajik State National University where he is majoring in economics.  He enjoys reading books and playing sports.  He is hoping to do well at the university.  He needs to pay his tuition, but doesn't have enough money to do so.  He is taking a loan to pay for his tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam was born in 1976. She is married and has three children. Her husband works in car rental. Ibtisam has been selling foodstuffs since two years ago. She started her project with a few products, and it expanded over time to be a supermarket. 

Ibtisam is planning to add variety to her products such as housewares and cleaners in order to raise her income to be able to support her husband in covering their children's needs. Now, she is asking for a loan to be able to buy those items.

loans.use: To buy housewares and cleaners.

loans.name: Seanghay

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Seanghay is aged 48 years and married with three children; one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. To add more income, she also works as a paid worker. Having been in this business for twenty-six years, she manages to earn about 46,000 KHR per day and can save about 22,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Seanghay is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now, she is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR to buy a proper motorbike for commuting to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent motorbike for using in her family.

loans.use: To buy a proper motorbike for commuting to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en: Fedaa was born in 1983. She is married and has two sons. Her husband and brother are in the military. Fedaa started making baskets using straw for the past one year. She started her project at home. Then, she started receiving requests from her neighbors. Fedaa is planning to expand her project in the future by opening her own workshop to sell her products. Now, she needs to buy raw materials such as more straw to increase her productivity and income in order to cover her children's needs. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more straw and other raw materials for her basket-weaving business.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна родилась в 1994 года. Она не замужем. Мавзуна умная и современная девушка. Она студентка 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Таджикистана. Мавзуна учится по специальности бухгалтера. Она учит хорошо все предметы, которые она изучает в университете. Она мечтает в будущем стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Она живет с родителями. Ее мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор в университете. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavzuna, born in 1994, is a smart and modern girl.  She is not married.  She is a second-year-student at the Tajik State National University, majoring in accounting and doing well in all subjects.  She is dreaming of becoming a highly skilled specialist one day.  She lives with her parents.  Although her mother works as a high school teacher, Mavzuna's parents are not in a position to pay for her education.  For that reason, she is taking a loan to pay her university tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Men is a 63-year-old married woman residing in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbung Khmum district. She has six children and earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for almost 40 years, she can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to make a living and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs.

Men has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used the past loan to better her living condition. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Men, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with six children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 54 years old.

Mary Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional foods like tempura, squid rolls, fish balls, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional foods like tempura, squid rolls, fish balls, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Savann's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, Savann is aged 27 years and married with three children, all of whom are still small. For the last four years, she and her husband have been selling fish, and sometimes her husband also works as a paid construction worker in the local area. The current business earns her family about 14,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per business.
 
Savann has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles, and she completely paid back the loans, which have enabled her to afford to better support the family. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to buy a motorbike for her her family's commuting. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family's commuting.

loans.name: Sroem's Group

texts.en:
A 35-year-old mother of two children, Sroem resides in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To support her living, she has been growing cabbage, while her husband is a paid construction worker. Together, they can earn about 23,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 15,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Sroem has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 170,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for construction of a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine for using in her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for construction of a proper latrine.

loans.name: Om-Munir Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Munir and consists of four members. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. Zakia is 40-years-old and is the leader of the group. She sells sweets. She has been doing this for four years. She says that she began this business when she felt her husband isn't able to cover all the expenses of his family. She is hardworking and through effort and dedication has managed to overcome adversity and get ahead. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business. She is working towards increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy sweets in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Gladys Ernestina  posee un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios en  unos de los mercados de la ciudad de león, se dedica a este negocio desde hace quince  años para  el sustento de su familia. 

La señora Gladys Ernestina se traslada a su puesto de trabajo a las 6:00 am y abre su negocio a la 7 am para preparar los mas riquísimos platillos que sus clientela le solicita,  finalizando a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sábado y el domingo hasta el mediodía.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar al por mayor de mercadería tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, carnes de res y de pollo, especies, el cual le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias y obtener mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Gladys Ernestina has a business where she sells food in one of the Leon city markets.  She has been doing this for 15 years in order to support her family.

Gladys Ernestina travels to her work place at 6:00 am and opens at 7:00 am to prepare the delicious dishes that her customers want.  She finishes at 5:30 pm Monday through Saturday, and at noon on Sundays.

She will use the money from this CEPRODEL loan to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef and chicken, and spices, which will allow her to increase her earnings and in more customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 28-years-old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store. Michelle has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as noodles, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en: Zaid was born in 1970. He is married and has four children. Zaid has been working as a blacksmith for the past five years. He started his project as a hobby. He also works at a private company. He is trying to earn better income to be able to cover all his children's needs. So, he is planning to expand his project; the first step to do that is to buy more iron in order to respond to his customers’ requests and raise his sales. But, he currently doesn’t have enough money for that. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more iron for his blacksmith workshop business.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah was born in 1959. She is married and lives in a rented house in an area in Jordan called Wihdat. Because Sabah is a conservative woman, she asked her son to appear in the picture instead of her. Sabah has been working in making furniture with her son for the past 11 years. To increase her profit, she needs to buy different types of wood. This will help her to add variety to her products and to raise her productivity and income as she currently doesn't have enough money for it. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy different types of wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1980. She is married and lives in a rented house in an area in Jordan called Irbid. Fatima has been selling blankets and accessories for the past one year. She started her project selling accessories only. Then she added other products. Fatima is planning to open her own store in the future. Now she is requesting a loan to be able to buy more blankets and accessories in order to raise her sales and profit. Because Fatima is a conservative woman, she asked her husband's cousin to appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy blankets and accessories to sell for her retail business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 52 years old and widowed with three children. Miguela works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell in her general store.

Miguela has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, noodles, bread, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Laura Lila Clariza

texts.es: En el municipio de Quezalguaque departamento de León, La señora Laura, se dedica a impartir clases como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 29 años, es Soltera con 1 hija a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo, ya que está estudiando, Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Laura atraviesa, es de realizar el pago de un lote de terreno, por lo que se decidió  de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar dicho pago.
texts.en: Laura lives in the city of Quezalguaque, within the Leon department, and works as a teacher in a small town elementary school.  She’s been doing this for 29 years.  She is single and has a daughter whom she wants to provide for, since she is attending school now.  One of the things Laura needs to do is pay for a piece of land, so she is asking for a loan through CEPRODEL.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon was born in 1979. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a retired man. So he doesn't have a strong source of income. Maysoon has been running her own beauty salon at home for the past four years. She started her project with few customers that consisted of her family and neighbors. Then they increased by time. Now Maysoon is planning to raise her productivity by buying cosmetic products and other tools for the salon. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and other tools for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 49 years old and has four children. Dolores is married and has two children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Dolores requests a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dolores has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 50 years old and married with two children.

Agustina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, bath soap, etc. in her general store.

Agustina has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Agustina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell like canned goods, biscuits, noodles, bath soap, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, milk, cream, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Francisca has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns additional income from fruit and vegetable vending.

Francisca aspires to build and expand her business to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, milk, cream, soy sauce and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda works hard to support her family. Rosenda has a live-in partner and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requests a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, coffee and other groceries to sell.

Rosenda has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, Rosenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, coffee and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Chicualense Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria de estado civil unida de hecho, cuenta con 26 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo que aun no estudiando, se dedica a tejer cortes y guipiles tipicos, unició este negocio con la ayuda de su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y telas para tejer variedades de estilos, desea en el futuro tener un local propio en el mercado del municipio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tejeduría y actividades pecuarias. En la fotografía faltan dos integrantes puesto que no pudieron asistir al momento de tomar la foto.
texts.en:
Maria is in a de facto union and is 26 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study. She has one child, who is not at school yet, and she makes a living by weaving traditional skirts and blouses. She began this business with the help of her mother and she now has six years of experience.
She organises a group and she is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase threads and fabrics to weave a variety of styles. In the future she wants to have her own shop in the market of her municipality. The other members of the group make a living from weaving and farming. Two members are missing from the photograph since they could not be present at the time the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase thread and fabric for weaving

loans.name: Pio Agustín

texts.es: El señor Pio , es casdo ,se dedica arduamente  a laborar como Coordinador técnico en el ministerio de educación, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 8 años y 23 año de haber ejercido la labor de maestro de primaria, es Casado con 2 hijas a su cargo, Una de las necesidades que el señor  Pio  atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, como es la construcción de un cuarto  y asi darle mejores condiciones a su familia, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Arena, Bloques,  Piedrín, Hierro, perlin  y Mano de Obra.
texts.en: Pio is married. He makes a living by working hard as a Technical Coordinator for the Ministry of Education. He has been doing this job for eight years, after having worked as a primary teacher for 23 years. He is married with two daughters in his care. One of the needs Pio has is to improve his home by building a room to give his family better living conditions. Since he has this need, he allowed himself to make the decision to visit CEPRODEL to request a loan for paying labourers and purchasing building materials, such as cement, sand, bricks, gravel, iron, and purlins.

loans.use: to pay labourers and purchase building materials, such as cement, sand, bricks, gravel, iron, and purlins

loans.name: Juana Lisbet

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica arduamente a laborar como maestra de educación primaria en un pequeño colegio del municipio dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 14 años. Es acompañada,y tiene  un pequeño un hijo al que le tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle. Una de las necesidades que presenta esta señora es de mejorar su vivienda ya que se encuentra  en mal estado, por este motivo es que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, perlines, arena, piedrín y el pago de la mano de obra, y de esta manera darle mejores condiciones a su familia
texts.en: Juana works hard as a primary teacher in a small school in her municipality. She has had this job for fourteen years. She has a partner and a young son, for whom she has to provide conditions conducive to his development. One of the needs this woman has is to improve her home, as it is in a bad state. It is for this reason that she approached CEPRODEL to request a loan so she can pay labourers and purchase construction materials, such as cement, purlins, sand, and gravel. In this way she will be able to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labourers and purchase building materials, such as cement, purlins, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is 56 years old and is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rufina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Rufina has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Rufina has been in this business for 23 years. Rufina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is 59 years old and married with four children. Santas works very hard to provide for her family.

Santas runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, bread, milk, etc. in her general store.

Santas has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, bread, milk, etc. 

Santas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, eggs, bread, milk, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Al-Matry Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Matry and comprises five ladies. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. Abeer lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is 31 years old and has nine children. She has been selling clothes for ladies. She is a professional in this field and her goods are sought-after in the market. She started her business with a small amount of capital to assist her husband in providing for their children's expenses. She is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business and improve the living standards of the family. Her dream is to expand her business in order to sell different products.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Asmahou

texts.fr:
Madame Asmahou  est née en 1985 à Sikasso, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est vit avec son époux dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Asmahou est tailleur de formation, à défaut de pratiquer cette profession elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  fruits (mangues, oranges,  bananes, papayes, avocat, ananas, etc.) depuis quelques années. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de  Sikasso et de façon ambulante. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ plus de deux année. Après trois prêts individuels bien remboursés, elle sollicite ce quatrième prêt individuel afin d’acheter  des chargements de charrettes en différents fruits pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante., 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Asmahou was born in 1985 in Sikasso. She's married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula-Ville, the city center of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

She's a trained tailor, but instead of practicing this profession, she became familiar with the buying and selling of fruits (mangoes, oranges, bananas, papayas, avocados, pineapples, etc) a few years ago.

She runs her business at the Grand Market in Sikasso, and as a traveling saleswoman. About two years ago, eager to better satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

After three personal loans that were repaid without problems, she's seeking her fourth loan in order to buy cartloads of various kinds of fruits and better meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

Thanks to this loan, she foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) to be used to help cover the expenses of her family, and repay the loan. She will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy cartloads of various kinds of fruits

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her children.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Alma has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, candies, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijos de 21, 17 y 9 años, solo la menor estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María es una muy buena esposa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y  ropa por catalogo. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todos los días domingo. Lo que más vende son los perfumes. Lleva más de 8 años que se dedica a las ventas con la cual ayuda a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en: Communal bank Chimborazo meets every other week at Picoaza church, in the town of Portoviejo, known as a market town and boasting traditional celebrations such as the San Pedro and San Pablo festivities. The people there are very cheerful. María lives in this town. She is forty years old, married, and has three children, aged 21, 17, and 9. Only the benjamin, a girl, goes to school. María's husband owns a shop. María is a very dutiful wife who, in order to have her own income, sells products of the brand Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies' accessories) and clothes from a catalog. She works four days a week and sells on credit: her customers pay her every Sunday. Perfumes are what she sells the most. She has been in this business for eight years, and her income helps her husband pay for household expenses. She asks for this loan to buy perfumes, moisturisers, cosmetics, and clothes of all kinds. She is one of the founding members of the communal bank she belongs to. She enjoys being a part of it because it helps her with her loans. Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, moisturisers, cosmetics, and clothes.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married, and works hard to support her family. Corazon has a buy and sell recyclable materials business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now.

Corazon requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials to sell.

In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials to sell

loans.name: Twubakiranire Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose  fait partie du groupe  Twubakiranire  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 42 ans et a 3 enfants âgés de 16 à 20 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce de restaurant  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capitale et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles (haricot, riz, régime  de bananes, …) à revendre dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle  voudrait  faire le commerce d’importation et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of Twubakiranire Group. She's a 42-year-old widow who lives in Bujumbura. She has three children, aged 16 to 20, who all go to school.

For twenty years, she's been selling food products. She's seeking her ninth loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. She will use it to bolster her working capital and buy a large quantity of products (beans, rice, banana bunches, etc) to resell in her store, in order to increase her income.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to get into the import business and see her children study.

loans.use: buy a large quantity of products (beans, rice, banana bunches, etc)

loans.name: Delfina Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Delfina, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12  y 7 años, los tres mayores  estudian en el colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña Delfina se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, su esposo también es comerciante de ropa y zapatillas, mientras ella vende por la localidad él se desplaza a otras ciudades o en el centro de la ciudad a vender sus productos, ella  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Lleva más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y es así como ellos luchan para que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y un mejor porvenir.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta porque gracias a los  créditos salen adelante. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Chimborazo" meets every 15 days in the Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional St. Peter and St. Paul festivities and for the cheerfulness of its people.

This is where Delfina, 38, lives.  She is married and has four children, ages 16, 14, 12 and 7.  The three eldest are in middle school and the youngest in grade school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Delfina sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis.  Her husband also sells clothing and shoes.  While she sells in the town he goes to other cities or to the city center to sell his products.  She sells her products on a credit basis and collects payment every Sunday.  She has been in this business for over four years.  This is how they struggle to give their children a good education and better future.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginnings; and she likes it because thanks to the loans she is able to get ahead.

Her dream is to continue prospering with her business.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina is 41 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erwina has a Fuller Life direct selling business in the Philippines. Erwina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more Fuller Life products to sell.

Erwina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Erwina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Fuller Life products to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 53 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of laundry soap, shampoo, coffee, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of laundry soap, shampoo, coffee, candies, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria
