After fulfilling its obligations to Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK), Ni Nyoman and the members of Bawi Lestari 2 Group get another loan. The loan amount is equal to the previous one. At the time of granting the loan, Ni Ketut, one of the members, could not attend because of religious ceremonies that could not be abandoned.

Ni Nyoman lives with her husband and all of her children are married. Besides maintaining pigs, Ni Nyoman was chosen to be a religious leader in charge of religious ceremonies in the village. 

With the capital now obtained, Ni Nengah will use it to buy piglets and the rest will be used to supplement the cost of feed. With the profit, she has a plan to make a larger cage for the proliferation of new piglets.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 24 years old with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a buy-and-sell perfume business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of perfumes to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Juan Pablo 43 años de edad acompañado con un hijo menor de edad, originario de uno de los municipios del norte del departamento de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, trabajador activo asalariado, Juan pablo desde hace mucho a querido realizar mejoras en sus vivienda pero por no tener los recursos económicos necesarios no los había logrado realizar, por lo tanto acude a nuestras oficinas con el deseo de realizar este crédito para lograr de culminar sus sueños de mejorar sus vivienda y así ofrecerle un techo digno donde vivir a su pequeño hijo, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en mejoras de sus casa actualmente esta construyendo un cuarto el cual necesita terminar debido a que la época lluviosa lo esta afectando, por lo tanto solicita financiamiento para la compra de laminas de zinc, cemento, cal, arena, bloques, perlines, clavos, ya que también esta terminando un muro perimetral.-
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 43 years old, in a relationship, and has one young child.  He is originally from one of the towns in the northern part of the Department of Chinandega, which is located in the western section of the country.  Juan Pablo is a salaried worker.  For quite some time, he has wanted to make improvements to his home but he does not have the necessary financial resources to accomplish this goal.  For this reason, he came to the offices of León 2000 IMF in order to request a loan so that he could fulfill his dream of improving his house and providing a decent home for his young son.  

The purpose of this loan is to invest in improvements to his house.  He is currently building a room that needs to be finished before the rainy season.  By requesting financing, Juan Pablo will be able to buy zinc sheets, cement, quicklime, sand, blocks, crossbeams, and nails.  He will also finish the construction of a security wall.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room and a security wall.

loans.name: Deilhen Shg Group

texts.en:
“Deilhen” means "chosen few" in Thadou dialect. Deilhen Shg group includes 12 women members who come together as one and form the group. They believe in hard work and loyalty.

Mary is one of the member in the group and she is the featured borrower member. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is engaged in a tailoring business and the town also acknowledges her work. Total dependence on her husband's income would surely bring them a huge debt with children's education fees and other expenses. She shares the family expenses by generating extra income from tailoring mosquito nets. 

Managing family expenses and efficiently running the business is not easy with little profits. Demand is high but sometimes she fails to supply because she can't afford the capital expenditure to purchase a the whole roll of the cloth to make the nets. Customers usually bring the cloth material to stitch when she can't provide it. Then she gets paid only for the labour she spends on tailoring. This is the biggest drawback in her business and she is determined to overcome this issue.

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase cloth material in bulk and sew the nets. All the generated income will be accounted as hers. That way, she has more opportunities to expand her business. She will repay the loan on time and will surely expand her business and earn more income. She aspires to own a more advanced sewing machine in the future and also to hire an assistant to efficiently run the business. She thanks Kiva and WSDS for the wonderful work and says she will always remain grateful.

The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, selling ice cream, and grocery, pharmacy and vegetable businesses.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for sewing mosquito nets and earning more income.

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah and all the members of Bawi Lestari 1 group have their new loan from MUK. They were very grateful because they were given a chance. The current loan is the same as the previous: 24.5M IDR (Indonesian rupiah) and seven members. 

Ni Nengah has three children who live with her. Ni Nengah is the backbone of her family because she does not have a husband. Her husband died because of sickness. In addition to raising pigs, Ni Nengah also worked as a poultry worker. Results obtained from working as a laborer are used to cater to their daily needs and her three children’s school fees. 

Now, after getting a new loan, Ni Nengah plans to increase the number of livestock by purchasing piglets, and the rest of the loan will be used for the purchase of feed. 

Ni Nengah and the Bawi Lestari 1 members have the expectation that there is still cooperation with the MUK, and the loan amount is added so that they can expand their livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La  socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de adornos de navidad, manteles, entre otros, a la vez continua trabajando en una empresa privada, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de adornos y peluches para su negocio. La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to manage a business of selling Christmas decorations, tablecloths, and other items.  At the same time, she also continues to work for a private company.  The borrower is a responsible and diligent individual.  She has been in business for a long time and it has brought her both financial and personal satisfaction.  She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy decorations and plush toys for her business.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy decorations and plush toys to sell in her business.

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзод родился в 1981 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние. Он имеет средне - специальное образование по специальности медицинского брата. Шерзод работает в поликлинике. Он имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Его жена помогает ему по введению бизнеса. Шерзод трудолюбивый человек. Он трудится с раннего утра до позднего вечера для того, чтобы получить больше дохода и улучшить условию проживания. Он должен купить школьные формы и школьные принадлежности для своих детей, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки школьных форм и школьных принадлежностей. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sherzod was born in 1981. He is married and has three young children. He has a high school degree in nursing and works in a health clinic. He earns additional income by growing crops and raising farm animals. His wife helps him to run the farm. Sherzod is a hard-working man. He works from early in the morning to late at night to earn more money and improve his family's living conditions. He has to buy school uniforms and supplies for his children but does not have the money, so he has asked for a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase these supplies. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms and school supplies for his children

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 46 years old, married, with seven children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Melanie has a coconut wine-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en:
Loeung (in the photo), age 54, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb and has four children, one son and three daughters. One is married and lives separately and the other two are garment workers. 

Loeung makes and sells typical Cambodian cakes at home. Her husband is a district officer. She is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work. He commutes to work by bicycle, but taking a bicycle is tiring and takes lots of time.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her sons to drive to work.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricicad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Julie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her tricicad business.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her tricicad business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 30 years old and married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as petrol, diesel, and kerosene. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy petrol, diesel, and kerosene.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, eggs, spices, canned goods, etc..

Lolita has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, egg, spices, canned goods

loans.name: Analita

texts.en:
Analita works hard to support her family. Analita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Analita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc..

Analita has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Analita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo.

loans.name: Deilhen (B) Shg Group

texts.en:
Caring and loving Thethem is pictured with her hand raised. She is blessed with three children and her husband makes a living by farming. Although she is married to the second son in the family, she takes the role of the eldest daughter-in-law by taking care of her differently able brother-in-law. She is the featured borrower member for Deilhen (B) Shg group. All the members live in the same village, which is about 40 kms away from the town capital of Manipur, which is also one of the northeastern states in India.

Thethem sells different varieties of rice. She gets the supplies from nearby land zamindars (large-scale land owners) and also from the main market in Imphal. Very few villagers own a paddy field and most of them depend on others' paddy fields. The harvest is insufficient and most of the villagers depend on the market for rice when in shortage. The entire family is under the financial support of her and her husband and the generated income is meagre, which usually causes her to cease her rice-selling business. 

With the loan from Kiva, she will purchase rice in bulk and make good sales. She will also repay the loan without fail and will surely open a savings account and manage it to be self-sufficient in the future. She thanks KIva and WSDS for the help and wishes them all good luck.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in piggery, weaving, selling cosmetics, and wool knitting.

loans.use: To buy more imported rice and local rice, sell it, and make more income.

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala (pictured with her loom), 30, is a silk weaver. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and has no children yet. 

Her husband’s business is selling mangoes. He buys mangoes on contract before harvesting for the future season and he needs to prevent them from insect bites by using pesticide.

Mala is applying for a loan to assist in her husband’s business. Her husband will use money from the loan to buy pesticide.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s business.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Sareth (in the photo), age 25, lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He got married in 2013 and has no children yet.  
Sareth and his wife are garment workers.  He is requesting his first loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 52 years old with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelina has a cigarette vending business in the Philippines. Evelina requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of cigarettes to sell.

In the future, Evelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Baasanjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Baasanjargal, 42 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse in a hospital since 2006. Her husband began rendering taxi services to local people three years ago using his own automobile. Her elder son just graduated from university with an engineering degree and is currently seeking a job. Her only daughter studies at university and her youngest son goes to high school. She is requesting a loan of MNT 5,600,000 to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fibreglass and foam in order to renovate her old house in preparation for the coming winter. Following renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place and will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. According to research conducted by the environmental ministry, coal burning is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a hard-working entrepreneur who is a buyer of dried coconut meat in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more dried coconut meat to sell for her dried coconut meat business.

Annabelle has been in this business for two years. Annabelle earns more income from farming coconut and a general store.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nora requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

Nora has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, spices.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 58 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household products to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

Leonida has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Leonida would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household products to sell

loans.name: Iem

texts.en:
Iem is 40 years old and married with five children, two of whom have settled down for marriage. She earns a living by cultivating rice crops on a small farm in Srei Santhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has been in this occupation for almost 25 years and is able to make a reasonable income to cover her living cost.

Iem is borrowing 800 US dollars loan through HKL to build a latrine, as she has insufficient money to buy enough construction materials and pay for labor costs. By having a latrine for her household, she can keep her environment clean, protect themselves from spreading diseases and increase their personal hygiene. 

She is very happy and thankful because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate, rather than its general loan rate. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Cesar Vallejo Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marlene  de 46  años de edad casada  y madre de  3 hijos, la Sra. Marlene  tiene una pequeña bodega   ya hace unos  10 años. La Sra. Marlene ,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes  el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su bodega  (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.)  Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Marlene  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Marlene  se le distingue por su casaca de color purpura,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 46, is married and the mother of three children. At this point, Marlene has had a small store for ten years. She has come to build loyalty in her clients, which has earned her profits to be able to cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own establishment where she can sell her products and obtain higher earnings. With the loan that was awarded, she will buy more products for her store (rice, sugar, soups, etc.) And in this way, she can keep meeting the needs of her customers and getting ahead.  

Marlene and all the members express their gratitude to Kiva for the loan that was given to them and for the trust that has been shown in them. Marlene can be spotted in her purple jacket. She leaves with a promise that she will fulfill all her proposed goals.

loans.use: products for her shop.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en: Jona lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines with her two children. She manages and operates her own rice farm to make a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and has access to the micro finance services of the cooperative and she recently borrowed a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to gain an abundant harvest and to save the generated revenue for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Jose Transito

texts.es:
José, vive actualmente acompañado y disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 4 meses y dos años. El, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos, dicha actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeño inculcado por su padre, del cual se sostiene hoy en día y lo realiza en la época de invierno, también es empleado de una panadería.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros para el fortalecimiento del que tiene en proceso. Esta inversión le ayudara a obtener la cosecha esperada que sea mucho mejor y abundante.
Su sueño es poseer un negocio más rentable que le genere mayores ingresos y de esa manera brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José has a spouse and enjoys his two children whose ages are four months and two years.  He works in agriculture growing basic grains. He learned said activity while still very young having been taught by his father.   Today, it’s his source of support and he does it in the winter; he’s also employed in a bakery.

He’s asking for the loan to buy needed agricultural supplies like manure, herbicide, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide, etc. to strengthen the crops that are currently developing.  This investment will help him get a good crop yield that will be much better and abundant.  His dream is to have a more profitable business that generates higher income so that he can provide better lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married and has five children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 46 years old.

Rowena has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a 8,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 17 years now. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and has nine children, some of whom are already with their own families. Her husband is a farmer, while she operates a tailoring shop in Libertad Bajo, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she lives. The business commenced 15 years ago and continues today. 

She really has skills in mending, creating and designing dresses of any kind - uniforms, casual dresses, capes, etc. She earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2006, Zenaida joined GDMPC. She enjoys the benefits of the services offered by the organization.  She took out loans before from GDMPC and has repaid them in full. Recently, Zenaida is borrowing PHP 15,000 to purchase materials to fabricate. She hopes to expand her business operations and not be left behind in society's current trends of fashion by keeping materials at all times.

loans.use: to purchase materials to fabricate.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. Rosemarie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soft drinks, chips, noodles, spices, eggs, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soft drinks, chips, noodles, spices, eggs.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para el negocio  de venta de frutas y verduras; esta inversión le ayudará a comprar manzanas, naranja, fresas, papas, cebollas, chiles, tomates, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar y obtener mayores ingresos, asimismo a adquirir más mercadería. Las condiciones económicas  y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Gloria needs to opt for a new loan because she needs more working capital for her fruit and vegetable sales business.  This investment will help her buy apples, oranges, strawberries, potatoes, onions, chilies and tomatoes, among others.

The previous loan helped her improve and earn higher income as well as to acquire more merchandise.  Her economic conditions and her family circumstances remain unchanged.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en: Lucia is 24 years old and she is married with one child. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking of how to run a larger business but she does not have enough capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is now applying for her second loan of $1,000 which she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her store such as fish, milk, salt, coffee, sugar, noodles, cigarettess and water .She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: To buy stock for her kiosk

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Joana to improve her business.She is married and has four children. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, fish, milk, cigarettes, water, slippers and oil. She is generating a good income from selling items from the kiosk. 

After years of working in business, she has been thinking of running a larger business. She is living in a town with her family and her husband is a teacher. She has goats and also has a house that is very simple. She is excited as it is very beneficial for her to help her family.

loans.use: To buy stock to sell in her kiosk

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  San José está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre,  madres y padres con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios del  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gustas disfrutar de  tiempo de calidad por su familia. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal San José es Maribel y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda de comestible que vende en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, fosforo, huevos, pan, leche, queso, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente. Ella dedica unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El  banco comuna San José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The San José communal bank is made up of nine members: eight women and one man, mothers and fathers with 15 children under their care. They are from Sauce, a place located in the northern part of the country. They are characterized for being responsible and hardworking, with a desire for self-improvement. In their free time, they like to enjoy quality time with their families. Unfortunately, they weren’t able to study much due to a lack of financial resources, and they found themselves forced to work from an early age in order to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator of the San José communal bank is Maribel. Her job is a pulpería located in her home. A pulpería is a small grocery store that sells items such as rice, beans, matches, eggs, bread, milk, cheese, sugar, oil, soap, and detergent in small quantities. She works some twelve hours daily, offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business so that in the not-so-distant future she can make a better profit. The San José communal bank expresses gratitude for the help that Kiva investors give to folks with few resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his grocery store with groceries such as rice, beans, matches, eggs, bread, milk, cheese, sugar, oil, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceité entre otros.


La socia está feliz con el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Juana, continues to run her restaurant business. She has spent years working on this business, which is going very well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day. The member prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners for all of her customers that ask for them. She is a responsible person, since it is in this way that she helps her family to get ahead.

The member is asking for this loan to buy ingredients like rice and oil, among other items.

The member is happy with the loan she has received, and is committed to making her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and oil, among other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. It is useful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the loan is being used in her family's everyday expenses. As of now, she is also a mineral water dealer. She is taking all the opportunities that she can get to have additional income.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Grace dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Teresina

texts.en:
Teresina is 28 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 30.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, sagiko, eggs, slippers, body lotion. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock for her kiosk

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Julieta to improve her business. She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. Her husband is a farmer and also has animals such as buffalo, horses, and chickens. 

Julieta has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies such as spoons, plates, plate racks, cigarettes, salt, fanta, body lotion, biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She has been operating her business since 2000. She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Julieta independent. She can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is very happy that this loan has been offered to help poor people improve their living conditions for the future.

loans.use: To buy spoons, plates, plate racks, cigarettes, salt, fanta, body lotion, biscuits, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Mr. Chinzorig, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He began working as a merchandiser at a retail company in January 2013. Before this job, he worked as an electrician at a power station. His wife has been selling mobile phones at a trade center by renting a stall but she stopped when she gave birth two years ago and now she stays at home looking after their two sons. He is requesting a loan of MNT 2,500,000 to purchase an electric car to use for work. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it producse no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. Therefore, it is good choice for him to purchase an electric car.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
Dewi Fortuna is a group located in a village in the western part of Bali. Jero Pudak is their head and they decided to have a new loans. 

Still involved in the pig business, they will use the loan to develop their businesses and will have enough savings at the end so they will be able to use it for business capital. 

Jero Pudak will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. She plans to save all the profit and wishes that all the pigs grow well. One member can’t attend the meeting and the board of the group is responsible to receive the loans.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets of a superior species.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes to local people by renting a stall in a trade center since 2011. Her husband runs an agribusiness which includes crop production, seed supply, farm machinery and retail sales. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,200,000 MNT to purchase farm machines such as a seeder, pumps and a harvester for her husband's business. By doing so, her husband will generate more income for his family. Profits from clothes sales is less than that of the agribusiness so investing in the more profitable business is more logical for this family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase farm machines such as a seeder, pumps and a harvester.

loans.name: Trok

texts.en:
Trok is a borrower, aged 33, residing in Bakan district of Pursat province. For more than five years, she has been working in a wedding embellishing business. She is specialized in doing make-up for the bride and bridesmaids of a wedding. Since it’s a seasonal business, she has encountered a challenge to make a consistent income in terms of her daily consumption. Aside from her hardships in this career, she also helps her husband manage their rice farm. This couple doesn't have a child yet, but they hope to have one soon.

For now, she needs a loan in order to build a bathroom and a water storage unit. By having these for the household, she will be able to improve her standard of living, promote their health and reduce the time and energy burden of collecting water. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate different from a general loan rate. 

She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a bathroom and a water storage unit.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El socio sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de bazar, el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, a la vez el socio sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesania, el socio es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de adornos y peluches para su bazar.
El socio se siente agradecido  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Adrian continues with his business selling in his store. He has been doing this for years. The business gives him satisfaction both personally and in question of revenue. He also continues in his handicraft business. Adrian is a responsible person and in this way he gets his family ahead. He is asking for this loan to buy ornaments and stuffed animals for his store. He is grateful for the loan and promises to pay his installments on time.

loans.use: to buy ornaments and stuffed animals for his store.

loans.name: Tito

texts.en: Tito is 48 years old, married and has children to look after. He is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice to sell. His family lives in Cagayan. He wanted to achieve better crop production but had insufficient funds as capital. He usually gets about PHP 20,000 used as revolving capital in his farming business to sustain his family's daily needs. He is asking for a loan to buy rice seeds, pesticides and insecticides for his farming. He hopes to continue generating good profits for the general welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticides and insecticides for his farming.

loans.name: Denalyn

texts.en:
Denalyn is 32 years old and is from the province of Isabela. She is married with three school-aged children. She is engaged in selling vegetables and fruits in their village. 

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy various vegetables like cabbages, tomatos, bananas and beans for her business. 

She is a hardworking mother, she makes sure she can provide for all the daily needs of her family through her business. In the future, Denalyn hopes that she can see her children finish their studies thus doing the best that she can do for their welfare.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables like cabbages, tomatos, bananas and beans for her business.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.en:
Fidel is a farmer peacefully living at Alcala with his spouse and child. He makes his living by patiently planting and harvesting rice to sell. He also pays additional laborers who helped him plant and harvest rice. Fidel acquires about 15,000 PHP twice a year (during harvest). He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm. It will help improve crop production. 

In the future, Fidel hopes to continue growing as a successful farmer and a good father to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Weftun Group

texts.es: Andrea, quien en la fotografía aparece al costado izquierdo de pelo corto y está al lado del único hombre; es parte del Banco Comunal Weftun, que está ubicado en Castro, Chiloé. En este Banco Comunal existen distintos rubros los cuales son tejidos, repostería, fabricación de lámparas de papel vegetal, venta de ropa reciclada, terapias con flores de Bach y venta de perfumes. El negocio de Andrea es venta de tejidos que ella misma hace, además cuando tiene un poco más de dinero puede comprar ropa nueva y perfumes los cuales vende. Comenzó con su negocio hace tres años, el tejido se lo enseño su suegra. El tiempo que ha trabajado no ha tenido problemas grandes, siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su familia. Con el dinero que recibirá quiere viajar a Santiago, Región Metropolitana; en donde quiere comprar carteras para vender. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es poder darse cuenta que es una ayuda cercana, mucho apoyo.
texts.en:
Andrea who appears on the left side of the photo with short hair standing to the only man is a member of the “Weftun” communal bank which is located in Castro, Chiloé.  There are several lines of work in this communal bank like weaving, pastry making, vegetable paper lamp making, used clothes sales, Bach flower therapy and perfume sales.

Andrea’s business is selling textiles she makes herself and also when she has a little more money she’s able to buy new clothes and perfume to sell.  She started the business three years ago; her mother-in-law taught her to weave.  She’s had no big problems while she’s been working; she’s always been able to count on support from her family.

She will use the money she’ll get to travel to Santiago, Metropolitan Region, to buy purses to sell.  What she’s liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza is having learned that help and support are available close by.

loans.use: to buy purses.

loans.name: Krissanty

texts.en:
Krissanty is a 30-year-old lady and is married to Petrus, a 32-year-old man. They are blessed with two children: Tiara, 8, attending third class of elementary school, and Brith, 2 years old. 

Krissanty is working as a part-time teacher at a general elementary school nearby her house. She has been working there for one year. In addition to working as a teacher, Krissanty also cultivates vegetables: cucumbers, cassava, papayas, corn, peanuts and string beans at their farm in her spare time. Krissanty is assisted by her brother in taking care of the farm and selling the crops, as well as while she is at the school. 

Krissanty was thinking to improve her business; she wants to buy more seedlings and fertilizer. This situation led her to request a loan of IDR (Indonesian Rupiah) 7,500,000 from TLM for her business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. It was useful for her businesses and served as additional capital. It is also helpful in her household's everyday expenditures. She is a jeepney operator and a computer shop owner. She also has a piggery and she sells charcoal. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 40,000 loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. She will also use the loan in her other businesses. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial help with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia dreams to be more successful in life and business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi, a 39-year-old lady, is married to Ibrahim, a 52-year-old man. From the marriage, they have five children, but only three children are living with them. Her oldest son is working in Malaysia, and her second daughter is married and lives with her family. 

Naomi is a copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production) and coconut oil trader. She usually purchases the coconut from farmers in nearby villages to produce coconut oil. She then sells it to the market located about 25 kilometers from her village.

Naomi is expecting that from this business, she will be able to generate more income for her family's needs. Therefore, Naomi needs capital to buy more coconut to improve her production. In addition, Naomi recently started a kiosk business in front of an elementary school. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM of 10,000,000 IDR (Indonesian Rupiah).

loans.use: to buy more coconut.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es trabajar en el área de administración en una entidad del estado, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal como gastos de educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Roxana lives in the city of Paucartambo.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising person who supports her family by means of her effort at work.  Her main economic activity is working in the administration area of a state entity.  She’s a responsible person which is why she was invited to participate in the “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank.  

On this occasion she needs a personal use loan to pay for her children’s schooling.  She is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Boldbaatar, 36 years old, lives with his wife and four children in a house on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people using his own automobile since 2007. His wife stays at home looking after their five-month-old son. His eldest and second son studies at university, and his daughter goes to kindergarten. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tughriks) to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. As his former car became deteriorated over the years, he needs a new car to use for his taxi service, as it is the only income generator for his whole family. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase and automobile which runs on natural gas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clean her plantation.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad,  está acompañada y vive en casa propia, tiene 33 años de edad y disfruta de un niño de tres años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la compra y venta de semillas de frijol para obtener ingresos para el fortalecimiento del hogar, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años y lo desempeña de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 6:00pm, ya que el negocio lo posee en su casa.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar frijol por cantidad. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar sus utilidades y fortalecer su negocio.
Su sueño es optimizar su situación económica y tener una mayor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Soledad is in a relationship and lives in her own home.  She is 33 years old and enjoys being with her three-year-old son.  Soledad buys and sells beans so that she can earn income to strengthen her household.  She has been in business for three years and works Monday to Saturday from 6:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.  Her business is located in her house.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beans in bulk quantities.  This investment will help to improve her profits and strengthen her business.  Her dream is to optimize her financial situation so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans in bulk quantities.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
This is Liezel, 23, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Mark, an employee. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Liezel is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning.  Many patrons prefer her products since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be use the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. 

Liezel hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and she dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fish to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad principal es enseñar  y trabaja como docente en un colegio de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal como gastos de educación de sus hijos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in the city of Paucartambo. She is a hard-working and enterprising person, who by the force of her labor gets her family ahead. She is a teacher in a secondary school in Paucartambo. She is a responsible person and for this reason she was invited to join the “Camino al Progreso” communal bank. 

At this time Sonia is requesting a loan for personal use, for the educational expenses of her children. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan and promises to pay the monthly installments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to pay the educational expenses for her children.

loans.name: Ngiv

texts.en:
Ngiv, age 51, started to work in the fields at a very young age, beside her parents and siblings. She has learned how to grow rice crops from her parents, and it has been a major source of her income so far. 

Rice is a very popular crop, growing in many hectares of farmland in the region of Battambang, which is well known for being the leading rice-producing province of the country. Through her hardships, Ngiv is able to make a net profit of $10 per day to support her living costs. She has a longterm relationship with a local farmer and has given birth to five children.

Ngiv has applied for a loan to build a bathroom, partly in order to increase the value of her home.  More immediately this will allow her to protect her family from spreading diseases and increase their personal hygiene. 

She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in order to protect her family and increase the value of her home.

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dolores. She previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Ma. Dolores' profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Dolores dreams that her business will continue to expand and she hopes to have a better life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Keila Vanesa

texts.es:
Keila Vanesa es una joven de 29 años de edad madre soltera de una niña de 5 años de edad la cual está cursando preescolar. Keila Vanesa es una mujer preparada con un grado de educación secundario completo la cual se graduó como maestra de educación para primaria e imparte clases en una escuela de la comunidad donde ella habita. Cuando ella no está en la escuela como docente, es agricultora la cual aprendió desde muy temprana edad gracias a sus padres quienes son agricultores desde toda una vida. Ellos le heredaron la tierra que ella trabaja para poder generar más ingresos y darle un mejor estilo de vida y una buena educación. Este año es su primera cosecha la cual ha trabajado por más de 2 años en preparación de la tierra y en darle la mejor asistencia posible a la plantación una vez sembrada la cual espera con muchas ansias para ver el fruto de su trabajo.

Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento con el cual espera dar el toque final a sus cultivos para que estos sean provechosos comprando 12 QQ de fertilizantes, 10 QQ de formula cafetalera y 12 QQ de urea para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café ya que con ello espera que su cosecha mejore y de excelentes resultados.

Sus metas para el futuro son ampliar sus tierras, sembrar una variedad de granos que ayuden al crecimiento de su negocio, a mejorar los ingresos para su hija y sobre todo a generar ingresos para darle una buena educación y enviarla a la universidad.
texts.en:
Keila Vanesa is a young woman of 29 years. She is a single mother to a five year old girl who is attending preschool. Keila Vanesa is a woman with a complete secondary education. She graduated as an elementary teacher and teaches classes in a school in the community where she lives. When she isn’t being a teacher in the school, she is a farmer, something she learned at a very young age from her parents. Her parents were farmers all their lives. The farm she works was passed on to her from her parents so that she could earn more profits and to give her a better lifestyle and a good education. This year is her first harvest; she has worked for over two years preparing the soil and giving the field the best care possible. Once it was sown, she anxiously waited to see the fruits of her labors.

Because of this, today she is asking for financing with which she hopes to give the final touch to her crops so that they will be profitable. She will buy 12 quintals of fertilizers, 10 quintals of coffee formula and 12 quintals of urea to give maintenance and help to her coffee crop because she hopes that her harvest will improve and have excellent results.

Her goals for the future are to increase her lands, to sow a variety of grains to help grow her business, to improve her profits for her daughter, and most of all to earn a good income in order to give her a good education and to send her to the university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 55 years old and married, with five children.

Carmelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, sugar, bread, shampoo, soap, canned goods, etc.

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid no fewer than 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 15 years, and she also earns an income from raising livestock.

Carmelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, sugar, bread, shampoo, soap, canned goods, etc., for her store

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc., for her general store.

Eleonor has been in this business for 10 years. Eleonor earns other income from buying and selling dried fish and raising pigs.

Eleonor has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica, de 39 años de edad, está casada con Heyner y vive en su casa propia junto a sus 02 hijos de 14 y 09 años de edad respectivamente. Yesica se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a través de catálogos, ofrece, delineadores, cremas, perfumes, ropas, joyas, etc. Realiza esta actividad en su casa en donde armo unA pequeña tienda para colocar todos los productos que tiene a la venta, lleva ya 03 años trabajando en esto y le va muy bien. Antes de realizar este negocio el  sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para los gastos de su familia, por ello decidió empezar con está actividad económica. Este es su quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará cosméticos por catálogo que están en promoción tales como, delineadores, lapiz labial, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes entre otros, para tenerlos en stock y poder maximizar su ganancia.
texts.en:
Yesica, 39, is married to Heyner and lives in her own house with her 2 children ages 14 and 9. 

Yesica sells cosmetics through catalogues, offering eyeliners, creams, perfumes, clothes, jewelry, etc... She does this activity in her house where she has a small store to display all the products that she has to sell. She has been working in this business for 3 years now and she's doing very well. Before working in this business the money her husband earned wasn’t enough to pay for household expenses so she decided to start this business. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to continue ahead. In addition, she promises to pay her monthly payments on time. 

With the 1,200 Peruvian Soles, the amount she is requesting, she will buy cosmetics in the catalogue that are advertised such as eyeliners, lipsticks, perfumes, talc, deodorants among other products, to have them in stock and to be able to maximize her profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in the catalogue such as eyeliners, lipsticks, perfumes, talc, deodorants among other products.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es: Vicentina vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad principal es la venta de autopartes de automóviles, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar pistones, llantas, aceites, grasa y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Vicentina lives in the city of Paucartambo. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person who helps her family to get ahead through her efforts at work. Her main economic activity is selling automobile parts. She is a responsible person, and because of this, she was invited to join the communal bank "Camino al Progreso" ["Road to Progress"]. 

She currently needs a loan to buy pistons, tyres, oils, grease, and other items. She is thankful for the loan and values it, and she is committed to making her monthly payments with a great degree of responsibility.

loans.use: to buy pistons, tyres, oils, grease, and other items.

loans.name: Ngang

texts.en:
Ngang, 47 years old, is a married woman with six adult children. She lives with her family in Kampong Cham province. She has been involved in the rice farming business for years, providing her family with its main source of income. She also owns a fish pond where she operates fish farming to supplement her income. She is happy because she has full support from her husband in managing their businesses.

Ngang is now requesting a loan of 1,500 US dollars to purchase building materials such as bricks, sand and cement, to build a bathroom in her house. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help in improving her living conditions, increasing the value of her home and protecting her family members from spreading waste pollutant, and increase their personal hygiene. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de hospedaje, la socia brinda hospedaje a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeño siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia antes se dedicaba al negocio de restaurante pero dejo este negocio para empezar con su negocio de hospedaje.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas para su hospedaje.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works in the accommodation business. She offers lodging to her clients who request it. She has been working in this business for a good while and it's going well thanks to the effort she makes every day. She is a responsible and persistent person and that is why she is able to get her family ahead. She previously worked in the restaurant business but left it to start her own lodging business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bed sheets for her guest house.

This member is thankful for the loan and she is committed to paying the monthly loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets for her guest house.

loans.name: Bin

texts.en:
Bin is 41 years old and lives with her spouse and three dependent children in her own house in Bakan district of Pursat province. She grows rice as her primary crop and other various crops as supplements, followed by rice according to the season. She is a responsible woman who is honest with her daily tasks in the fields. Thanks to the work she does, she is able to pay for some of her expenses and educate her children in school.

In order to fulfill the basic household needs, Bin has requested a loan in order to build a latrine in her house. This will enable her to increase the value of her home, protect her family members from spreading waste pollutants, and increase their personal hygiene. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: build a latrine for her house

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Carlos tiene 51 años de edad,05 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de transporte ,el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "ILLARY III." The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Carlos, is 51 years old. He is married and has five children. He alternates his daily activities, offering transportation services. He has spent a good amount of time working in this field, and it is going very well thanks for the hard work he puts in to his business every day. The member is a responsible and hardworking person, since it is in this way that he helps his family to get ahead.

He is asking for this loan to buy tyres for his car.

The member is grateful for the loan, and he is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tyres for his car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old and is supporting two children aged 24 and 18 years old.

She has a retail shop in Ndunyu Mjeru which she has operated for five years. She has applied for her sixth loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy a stock of rice, flour and buckets, among others, now that she has paid back her previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit, she plans to boost her business and pay school fees.

She hopes to expand her retail business so as to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of rice, flour and buckets among others.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 57, the mother of five children, and lives in Casibarag. Her husband has operated a motorcycle transport for ten years, earning a net income of PHP 200. 

In order to help her husband sustained their everyday needs, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 for their motorcycle repair and maintenance.

loans.use: to repair and maintain their motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Geraldine dreams that her business will continue to flourish, and hopes to give her children what they need. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 28 years old, is married and lives in the simple village of Casibarag. She has been in her hog-raising business for five years, and she wanted to expand it to gain more income. 

In order to do that, she is requesting an initial loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and an additional piglet. 

As a mother, she wanted to save some of her income for the future of her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and an additional piglet.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her general merchandise store. She also bought more Vita-Plus products. She also has a house rental and she earns Php 4,000 monthly for that. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julie dreams of achieving her goals in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and school and office supplies to sell

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 59 years old and single.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

Fatima runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.  She has been running her charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from selling dried coconut meat and farming rice.

Fatima requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  She has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Fatima aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, two of whom are in school, Imelda works hard to support her family.

Imelda has a fish selling business in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from buying and selling chickens. Imelda is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish business.

Imelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 42 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Marilou has been farming sugarcane for 2 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fertilzers and farm supplies

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en: Nusura appreciates the support. The previous loan helped her to boost the living standards of her family and the new firewood business was also well stocked. Here again she comes to you for another loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for sale.

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es:
René, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere más capital de trabajo para su actividad de la agricultura; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar ganado para reposte.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores  ingresos, es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han  mejorado.
texts.en:
René finds himself in need of a new loan, as he needs more working capital for his agricultural work. This investment will help him to buy cattle to replenish his herd.

His previous loan helped him to increase his inventories and earn a better income, and thanks to that, his economic conditions and his family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy cattle to replenish his herd.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Dios es Amor está conformado por nueve integrantes madres solteras, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellas se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, y con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ninguna pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligadas a trabajar a temprana edad en la que viven, y luchan día a día para Salir adelante con sus pequeños hijos.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor, tiene sus diferentes actividades económicas.  Bertha es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la venta de leche, y cuajada en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diaria, ofreciendo sus productos, a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de leche, y cuajada  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank “Dios es Amor” is made up of nine members, all of whom are single mothers. Together they are responsible for twenty children. The women are natives of Malpaisillo, an area in the northern part of the country. They are known for being hard-working and responsible, and for their strong personal desire to succeed. Sadly, none of them were able to go to school because they did not have enough money, and they had to start working at an early age. The women fight every day to get ahead with their young children. Thanks to their entrepreneurial spirit, they each have a business. 

Bertha is the coordinator of the community bank. She works more than ten hours each day, selling milk, cheese curds and other dairy products to her regular and occasional customers. She does this both from her home and as a traveling vendor from place to place. Bertha is requesting this loan to invest in working capital to buy and sell milk, cheese curds and other dairy products. She hopes to improve her income in the near future.   

The community bank “Dios es Amor” is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with limited resources in developing countries like Nicaragua so that they can have appropriate work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy and sell milk, curd and other dairy products.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.en:
Libertad is 61 years old. She is married and has 5 adult children. She lives in Libertad Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. 

Libertad is engaged in a business selling items such as fish, vegetables and seafood.  She has been in his business for more than 20 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 3200. 

Libertad has requested a new loan to be used to purchase construction materials needed for house repair.  She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since April 2005.  Libertad hopes that she can earn more out from her business in order to sustain their daily bread and be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: buy construction materials to renovate her house

loans.name: El Triunfo El Sauce Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Triunfo el Sauce  está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad con ganas de salir adelante,  estos  integrantes son originarios del  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos,  y les preparan comida típica de la región como “nacatamales” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es Gloria y tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos en pie a clientes fijos y eventuales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal El Triunfo Sauce agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Triunfo el Sauce is made up of nine members- eight women and one man, who are responsible for fifteen children who want to succeed. These members are originally from Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. They are characterized by being hard-working and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement. In their free time they like to enjoy the company of their children, and they prepare traditional food from the region like “nacatamales”. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and they saw themselves as obligated to work from a young age to help with home expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to come out ahead, the coordinator of the bank is Gloria. Her economic activity is the purchase and sale of pigs on foot to regular and possible customers. She works some 8 hours of her business daily offering her products so that in the not-so-distant future she can make a better income.
