The communal bank El Triunfo Sauce appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, allowing them to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in work capital and supply her business purchasing and selling pigs on foot.

loans.name: Lorevie

texts.en:
Lorevie is 33 years old and lives in Brgy.1, Tangub City. She is married with three children.

Lorevie engages in cell phone electronic loading and distribution, and earns approximately PHP12,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional cellphone load cards to sell. 

Lorevie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 6 months. In the future, Lorevie hopes to improve her livelihood to provide more services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional cards of cellphone load to sell

loans.name: Misma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Misma works hard to support her family.  She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop. 

Misma is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pig business.  She had successfully paid back her previous loans and now requests a new loan to further build her raising pig and coffee shop businesses.

Misma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy pig feed

loans.name: Susima

texts.en:
Susima is 61 years old and has six children.  She is married and has children who are in school.

Susima is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds.  Susima has been rising ducks for 7 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  

Susima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy duck feed

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.   Cecelia has been in this business for 2 years.  She also earns more income from a general store.

Cecelia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, fish, etc. for her restaurant business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Priscila requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Priscila is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Casilda, de 52 años de edad, está separada del  padre de sus hijos los cuales ya son independientes, por está razón vive sola en su casa propia. Casilda se dedica a la venta de comida rápidas como pollo frito, papas fritas, además de menús y desayunos porque da pensión a los trabajadores de un taller cercano a su hogar, además su puesto de venta lo instala en el frontis de su casa, desde donde viene atendiendo hace 05 años a sus clientes contando con la ayuda de su hermana para la preparación y atención al público . Le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite contar con un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 3500 nuevos soles comprará mesas y sillas, además de utensilios de cocinas como ollas, cucharas, platos para implementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
Casilda, 52, is separated from the father of her children whom are already independent; therefore she lives alone in her own house. 

Casilda is in the fast food business such as fried chicken, French fries as well as menus and breakfasts because she gives meals to the workers at a workshop near her home. In addition, her stall is in front of her house where she has been serving her customers for 5 years with the help of her sister for the preparation and serving the public. She likes her work since it allows her to have an income to pay her expenses. 

This is her second loan with Kiva therefore she hopes for a small loan to be able to fulfill her goals. With the requested amount of 3,500 Peruvian Soles she will buy tables and chairs, in addition to kitchen utensils such as pots, spoons and plates to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and kitchen utensils for her stall.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, 43 years old, is a married entrepreneur in Tuburan, Aloran, in the Philippines.  He has three children.

Joel earns PHP 13,000 per month by raising and selling ducks.  In 2008 he joined GDMPC Micro Credit to help him grow and improve his business. He successfully repaid his previous loan, which helped his business remain successful. 

Joel is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy additional ducks to raise for expansion. He’s hopeful that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ducks to raise for expansion

loans.name: Yeris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yeris del Carmen habita en el municipio de El Sauce, un pequeño poblado ubicado al occidente de León rodeado de montañas florecidas y ríos caudalosos por la temporada de invierno.
Doña Yeris inició su negocio hace siete años con una pequeña pulpería donde ofrecía lo esencial para el hogar, hoy en día su negocio ha crecido gracias a los financiamientos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel con la ayuda de los fondos Kiva. También como siempre le ha gustado preparar comida instaló una fritanga en su vivienda donde todos los días por la noche vende lo que es carne asada, pollo asado, tajadas, tacos, enchiladas.
Se presentó a Ceprodel en busca de un nuevo financiamiento con el objetivo de surtir su negocio de productos que demandan sus clientes y así satisfacerlos como arroz, frijoles, verduras, pollo, carne de cerdo y salsa de tomate.
Confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón aprueben su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión y así poder seguir desarrollándose como pequeña comerciante.
texts.en:
Yeris del Carmen lives in El Sauce, a small town located in the east of Leon, surrounded by flowering mountains and great rivers because of the winters.

Yeris started his business seven years ago, with a small store where she offers the essentials for the home.  Now her business has grown, thanks to the loans she has gotten through CEPRODEL, with the help of funds from Kiva.  She also likes to prepare fried food from her restaurant, located in her home, every day, where she sells grilled meats, roasted chicken, sliced meat, tacos, and enchiladas.

She approached CEPRODEL in search of new financing so she could stock her business with things such as rice, beans, vegetables, chicken, pork, and tomato sauce.

She trusts in God that these people with good hearts will approve her request so she can make this investment and develop herself as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Haidie

texts.en:
Haidie, 39 years old, is married and has six school-aged children. She lives in the village of Casibarag.

She is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a net income of 1,500 PHP per pig when she sells one. She wanted to earn more income, so she has requested a loan to buy hog feed to support the growth and maintenance of her pigs. She is confident that her business as a hog-raiser can help her support the education of her six children.

loans.use: to buy hog feed

loans.name: Sangimurod

texts.ru:
Сангимурод скотовод и фермер. Ему 44 года. Он из района А.Джоми. У него жена и трое детей. Сангимурод очень трудолюбивый человек. Он одновременно занимается двумя видами деятельности: животноводством и растениеводством, и уже 14 лет как успешно продвигает их. Сангимурод имеет 0,45 га приусадебного и президентского участков земель, на которых выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Сейчас в его хозяйстве имеются два дойных коров и один теленок. 
Сангимурод готовится к осеннему посеву и просит кредит для приобретения семян лука, капусты, картофеля, а также минеральных удобрений и ГСМ. Он надеется получить хороший урожай и за счет прибыли провести ремонт в доме и подготовиться к зиме.
texts.en: Sangimurod is a shepherd and farmer. He is 44 years old. He is from the A. Dzhomi region. He has a wife and three children. Sangimurod is a very hard-working man. He is simultaneously engaged in two activities: raising pigs and cattle, and agriculture, which he has been successfully engaged in for 14 years. Sangimurod has 0.45 hectares of land and government plots on which to grow crops. Now on his farm he has two dairy cows and one calf. Sangimurod is preparing for the fall planting season and asking for a loan for onions seeds, cabbage, as well as fertilizer and fuel. He hopes to have a good harvest and to use the profits to repair his house and prepare for winter.

loans.use: to acquire onion seeds, cabbage, potatoes, as well as fertilizer and gas for the autumn planting season.

loans.name: Jose Efrain

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para el inicio de la siembra de maíz; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesita, tales como: semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ingresos y los invierte en los gastos del hogar. Gracias a este crédito ha mejorado las condiciones económicas y se encuentran muy bien de salud su familia.
texts.en:
Jose has been presented with the necessity of applying for a new loan, since he requires more work capital to begin sowing corn. This investment will help him buy the agricultural supplies that he needs, such as: corn seed, compost, herbicide, and pesticide, among others.

The previous loan helped him to increase his income, which he invests in his home expenses. Thanks to this loan he has improved his economic conditions and his family has very good health.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, compost, herbicide, and pesticide, among others.

loans.name: Edwige Chantal

texts.fr: edwige voudrait grâce à ce nouveau  crédit acheter du matériel de papeterie à savoir des formats , des  enveloppes, des   blocs  notes... ceci dans le but de pérenniser son activité et assurer l'avenir de ses enfants.le précédent crédit lui ayant permis d'acheter un nouveau matériel bureautique( un copieur) ,d'agrandir son activité en ouvrant un "call box" et d’acquérir des pièces de rechanges nécessaire pour rendre son imprimante plus fonctionnel . la situation familiale de la cliente  reste inchangée depuis le précédent crédit.
texts.en: Edwige would like to buy paper products, including notebooks, envelopes, notepads with her new loan… all this to ensure the longevity of her business to ensure the future of her children. Her previous loan allowed her to buy a new piece of office equipment (a copier), to expand her business by opening a “call box” and to acquire the necessary spare parts to make her printer work. The client’s familial situation remains unchanged since the previous loan.

loans.use: to purchase a copier and office supplies

loans.name: Assoupi

texts.fr: Assoupi âgée de 43 ans,  pratique la revente des produits d’alimentation Générale dans une boutique de la place. Elle est mariée à un banquier et est mère de 05 enfants  tous scolarisés. Son premier enfant  a 18 ans et le dernier a 04 ans. Elle a débuté cette activité il y a un moment et sollicite son quatrième prêt auprès de WAGES pour acheter les produits alimentaires manquant dans sa boutique. Elle compte revendre ses produits et épargner ses profits pour ouvrir une seconde boutique plus tard. Elle souhaite contribuer avec son mari à offrir une meilleure condition de vie à sa famille.
texts.en: Assoupi, 43, sells food products in a shop in her neighborhood. She is married to a banker and is a mother of five, all of whom attend school. Her first child is 18 and her youngest is 4. She started this business a while ago and is seeking her fourth loan from WAGES to buy food products that are missing from her shop. She plans to resell these products and to save her profits to open a second shop later on. She would like to contribute with her husband to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Aklesso

texts.fr: Revendeur de gaz butane, Aklesso jeune homme de 34ans est marié et a 02 enfants en charge. Seul le premier de 05ans est scolarisé. Pour supporter les charges familiales, il revend depuis 2013 des gaz butane et sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Il espère avec le profit louer une boutique pour installer ses marchandises et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: A reseller of butane gas, Aklesso, a young 34-year-old man, is married and cares for two children. Only the eldest, who is 5, attends school. In order to keep up with the family expenses, he has been selling butane gas since 2013 and is seeking his first loan with WAGES to buy more products. He hopes to rent a shop with the profits to set up his products and ensure the well being of his family.

loans.use: to buy gas

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 34 years old and lives in Brgy. Prenza, Tangub City. She is married with one child. She enjoys the business of cosmetics. She sells Avon products and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Gloria has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory of cosmetics for retail. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her livelihood in order to provide more services for her clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of cosmetics for retail

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
This is Maria Victoria. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Victoria hopes to have a happy family and dreams of having financial stability. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is married with four children and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. Her husband is a carpenter and she helps to earn money by buying and selling coconut to make a living. 

Hilda has borrowed 4,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy more coconut to resell as copra and charcoal. She is thankful to this partner, which enables her to continue her business to improve her general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to resell as copra and charcoal

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 43 years old and married, with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Dolores is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gulomjon

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Гуломджон. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более12  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Он так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A kind man, who is always trying to improve the standard of living and is hoping for a bright future, is in need of financial support.  His name is Gulomjon. He is married and is raising a child.  Since he lives in the countryside, he has a great opportunity to grow his cattle business.  He has been raising cattle for more that 12 years and has a lot of experience in this particular work.  He is so skilled at taking care of his cattle, it is as if, he understands their language.  Because his cattle are so well cared for and are so healthy, he has regular customers.  

He wishes to grow his business and to increase his income.  He is planning to use his profits to improve his standard of living.  He is asking for a loan of 7000 somoni to purchase cattle.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle so he can grow his business

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзоду 18 лет. Он является студентом 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Шерзод учится по специальности Финансы и кредит. Он умный молодой человек и с занятиями справляется отлично. Его мать работает учительницей в средней школе. Его отец предприниматель. Мать Шерзода всегда мечтала, чтобы ее сын получил высшее образование и служил своей родине. Его родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор. Шерзод запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sherzod is 18 years old.  He is a first year student at the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. Sherzod is studying in the department of Finance and Loans.  He is a smart young man and he is a great student.  His mother is a high school teacher and his father is a barber. Sherzod's mother had always dreamed that her son would get a university education and serve his country.  Unfortunately, his parents are not able to pay for his tuition, so Sherzod is asking for a loan to pay for his university education.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Kumry

texts.ru: Кумри родилась в 1967 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Она более 5 лет работает в швейном цехе. Кумри имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания сельхоз культур. Она имеет среднее образование. Кумри всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее сын Бехзод в этом году поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Кумри должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Kumry was born in 1967.  She is married and has three children.  For more than five years, she has been working at a sewing factory.  Kumry has additional income from growing various crops.  She has high school education.  Kumry had always dreamed that her children would get university education.  This year, her son Behzod, had enrolled into the Khujand State University.  Kumry is asking for a loan because she needs to pay for her son's university tuition.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university tuition.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 46 years old, married, and lives at Motibot, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she raises pigs in her backyard. 

She obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed, by taking a loan from Paglaum MPC. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, providing income in addition to the earnings of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage, to enable her to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Danita

texts.en:
This is Danita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, and she is thankful for the financial assistance given to her. Aside form her direct selling business, she also has a small food stall where she sells some food for snacks. She and her husband are working to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time 35,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more items to increase her product inventory. The more items she has available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and the daily needs of her family. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Danita hopes to have other sources of income with which to provide for her family, and she dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to increase her product inventory, like clothing, footwear, and personal care products

loans.name: Maruush

texts.en:
Mr. Maruush, 54 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land. He has been working as a pump machinist at an engineering company, for over twenty years. His wife is unemployed currently and stays at home. Their children all work and support their family.

Maruush is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT. He will use it to purchase building and insulation materials, such as bricks, planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he wants to repair and insulate his house, thus creating a comfortable and warm place for his family. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, and consequently, to release fewer pollutants into the air. The burning of coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia, according to a state research department.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Philomene Sandrine

texts.fr:
philomene est une jeune femme de 29 ans vivant en concubinage avec son conjoint  et d'un enfant âgé de 4 ans. elle a 5 ans d’expérience  professionnelle dans son activité. le succès de son activité est lié  au fait qu'elle est située à proximité d'un collège à cet effet, elle fait face à une forte demande des élevés en photocopies, papier format et autre matériel raison pour laquelle son activité est très prospère. 
le crédit qui lui est accordé lui servira à acheter un copieur , réaménager son cadre de travail et améliorer sa condition de vie ainsi que celle de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Philomene is a young woman aged 29 who lives as husband and wife with her partner and a four-year old child. She has five years of experience in her profession. The reason for the success of her business is partly because it is situated near a college which means that many of the college pupils need photocopies, special format paper and other materials, which is why her business is doing very well.
She will use the loan that is granted to her to buy a copying machine, to refurbish her workplace and to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy office materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a sanitation system.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru: Фариза родилась 1995 году в сельской местности. Она училась в средней школе отлично и активно участвовала в общественной жизни школы. Фариза после окончания средней школы поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Ее родители поддерживают ее, так как они тоже имеют высшее образование и всегда хотят, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и служили народу. Фариза должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fariza was born in 1995, in the countryside.  She was a great high school student and she actively participated in the social life at school. After finishing high school, Fariza enrolled into the Khujand State University.  Her parents support Fariza in her education plans, since they too have university degrees and wish that their children obtain advanced education so they could serve their people.  Fariza is asking for a loan to pay for her university tuition.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is married to a carpenter, and they have four children. She lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. For two years, she has been selling ready-to-wear clothes ("RTW") and dry goods, like blankets, towels, and assorted dresses. She makes her sales in her community, to earn a living.

She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC since 2011. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 to buy more RTW and dry goods to resell. She is hoping to generate more revenue, which would enable her to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes and dry goods to resell

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel lives in Casibarag. She is 31 years of age, married, and has three children. Her husband's business is operating a Philippine traditional transport, which is called a "kalesa." (A "kalesa" is a cart pulled by a horse, as a means of transportation). This means of transportation is considered environmentally friendly, because it is smoke-belching free. They have been five years in the business, with an average income of PHP 300, every week. 

As a loving wife, Anabel wants to help her husband even in a simple way. Anabel is requesting a loan to buy new wheels for their "kalesa." New wheels will make the horse's job easier, to pull the cart. They give also great effort in taking care of their horse, as their partner in the business.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for their horse-drawn cart

loans.name: Javlonbek

texts.ru: Джавлонбек молодой и энергичный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Джавлонбек после окончания средней школы поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Он в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу и занимается спортом. Джавлонбек мечтает получить свой диплом и работать в какой-то организации. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью он обратился за займом. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Javlonbek is a young and charismatic young man.  He is 18 years old.  He is not married and lives with his parents.  After high school, Javlonbek enrolled into the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business.  In his free time, he reads foreign literature and plays sports.  Javlonbek dreams of getting a university degree and working in some organization.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition.  He is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is thankful for the financial assistance that has been extended to her.  With it, she was able to buy more ready-to-wear products needed in her business.  Her loan was also helpful in managing her family's everyday expenses.  She is also selling food supplements to earn additional income. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that would enable her to buy and stock additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she can display at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in increased profit.  Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adora hopes that her business will be more successful.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and her business as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Tereze

texts.en:
Tereze wants to start up a bar-cafe, plus groceries and snacks, or all-in-one type of activity, in the village where she resides. This will be near a school, thus the clientele is guaranteed. With this loan, she wants to stock up on inventory items. Currently her store is empty, so she chose to be photographed at another, similar store, located in the vicinity.

When the loan officer told her that she needed to be photographed so that Kiva lenders would see her, she said, laughing: “I want to be photographed in a store that is already established, because that brings good luck according to some superstitions in our region.” Tereze is a married mother of four children.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for her all-in-one store and bar-cafe

loans.name: Irembo Group

texts.fr:
Cassilde fait partie du groupe  Irembo et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 47 ans  et est mariée à Laurent, un commerçant.

Elle  fait le commerce des habits  depuis 14 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Cassile is a member of the Irembo group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 47 and married to Laurent, a shopkeeper.
She has been selling clothes for 14 years.
She is on her fifth loan from Turame. With the Kiva  loan that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy many clothes for resale, in order to earn more.
In the years to come she would like to buy a plot of land and see her children studying.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many clothes for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Trezah

texts.en:
Trezah, a 45-year-old married mother of three, has operated a pharmacy in Kangundo town for four years. She is now requesting her second loan from KADET LTD to buy more medicine, including syrup and tablets, to sell. She also plans to buy medical equipment. 


Trezah will expand her business with her anticipated profits and hopes to eventually open another business and educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more medicine and medical equipment.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, a 54-year-old married mother of five children, two of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. Fe buys and sells native products in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more such products to sell.


In business for 21 years,  Fe would like to save money to expand her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of native products to sell

loans.name: Sonila

texts.en:
Sonila is a 33-year old divorced woman who lives in a little town.  She has been selling clothing for the past five years in order to support herself financially.  She needs help from lenders to buy some more clothing and increase her inventory of items to sell. 

Sonila said, “I had never applied for a loan in the past because I was fully aware of my financial condition.  However, when I was approached by the loan officer from VisionFund Albania and informed that lenders from Kiva could help me financially, I was totally thrilled.  Right away, with the help from the loan officer who interviewed me, I submitted the application without thinking twice and I am hopeful that they will be generous in helping me out.”

Sonila wants to get married and have her own family soon.

loans.use: to stock her inventory of clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Hait

texts.ru: Хаит родился в 1968 году. Он с детства был трудолюбивым и ответственным. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Его дети учатся в университете и в средней школе. Хаит более 15 лет работал в фабрике электриком, но так как у него зарплата была маленькой, он ушел с работы и начал самостоятельно предоставлять услуги электрика. Хаит всегда мечтал, чтобы его дети получили высшее образование. Его сын Назир в этом году окончил среднюю школу. Ему 17 лет. Он поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет. Хаит должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и с такой целью он запрашивает займ. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hait was born in 1968.  Since the time when he was young, he has always been very hardworking and responsible.  He is married and is raising three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Some of his children are studying at the university and some are still in high school.  For more than 15 years, Hait had worked as an electrician at a factory.  Since his salary was low, he left that job and started his own business as an electrician.  Hait has always dreamed that his children would obtain a university education.  This year, his 17 year old son, Nazir, has finished high school and enrolled into the Khujand State University.  Hait is asking for a loan to pay for his son's university tuition.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Nyam-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Nyam-Ochir, 39 years old, lives with his daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He divorced his wife one year ago. He has been selling building materials, such as wallpaper, fiberglass and cement, since 2005. He sells to local people, by renting a stall at an outdoor market. His daughter goes to high school.

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT. He will use the loan to purchase building materials from a border city of China, at the wholesale price and in large quantity. With the materials on hand, he will be able to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. This business is the only income source on which Nyam-Ochir's and his daughter's lives depend.

loans.use: to import building materials in large quantity, at the wholesale price

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
This is Jennie, who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her child’s education as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.


Jennie is requesting another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.


Jennie's dream is for her business to grow as she hopes to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zongolica Group

texts.en:
Wenceslao, Miguel, and Adolfo live in Tlaxcantitla, a remote indigenous community in the Zongolica region in the state of Veracruz.  The region is very mountainous and somewhat complicated, so they have lacked electricity access since the community was established. 

This is Wenceslao's story:

Wenceslao is a 33-year-old man living with his family of 8, in the community of Tlaxcantitla.  Over the years, Wenceslao has learned the craft of agriculture, and now he mainly works in the field cultivating corn.  He also sometimes sells firewood in his community to earn more money, because his income is only $23-27 USD on a productive week. 

By acquiring a solar home system, Wenceslao will be able to improve his family's quality of life and spend his monthly income on better food and clothing for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to improve productivity.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомджону 38 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он заботливый отец двоих детей и всегда старается для их благополучия. Илхомджон более 18 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Он начал свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Постепенно он развевал свой бизнес. Данное время он имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства и купле продажей продуктов питания. Илходжон всегда старается получить больше дохода и обеспечить семью с хорошим условием проживания. Он уже несколько лет планирует построить новый дом для семьи, но так как он не имеет денег, он обратился за займом в сумме 8000 сомони для покупки цемента, камни для постройки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ilhomjon is 38 years old.  He is married and is raising 3 children.  He is a caring father of two children, who always tries to provide them with all of the necessities.  For more than 18 years, Ilhomjon has been running his own business, which he started with growing of crops.  He gradually expanded his business, and today, he has additional income from raising cattle and from selling groceries.  Ilhomjon is always trying to increase his income and to provide his family with improved living conditions.  

For a few years now, he has been planning to build a new house for his family.  Since he does not have the money do to so, he is asking for a loan of 8000 somoni to purchase cement and stone for the construction of the new house.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cement and stone to build his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her rug-making business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 38 years old and married. She has three children. She has a maize mill in Kangundo town, where she sells flour and provides maize milling services. She has been in the business for four years, and it has been profitable. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more maize for milling, and then she will sell the flour. Most of her customers are from within the town. She will use the anticipated income to open another maize mill business. This is her second loan term with KADET, and she repaid her previous loan successfully.

Damaris hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy maize, for milling into flour to sell

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.en:
Abelardo, 58 years old, farms rice to sustain his family's daily needs. His family serves as his motivation in pursuing his goal of greater crop production. He plants and harvests rice twice a year, earning about PHP20,000 every harvest.


Abelardo would like to increase his income and so is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. These purchases will ensure his crops' good growth and nutrition, leading to a higher yield. If approved, Abelardo promises to pay back the loan after the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in maintaining his crops.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business that produces brooms in the Philippines.  Anecita has been in this business for 36 years.  In addition, Anecita earns more income from selling fruit.

She is borrowing 4,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional raw materials like bamboo, wood, etc. necessary for the production of brooms.

Anecita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: San Fernando Ii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Fernando II está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 12 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadores, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligas a trabajar desde temprana edad, para  ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal es  Modesta y tiene por  actividad ecomica una pulpería una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, sal, huevos, queso, tiste, crema, jabón. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  San Fernando II agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "San Fernando II" communal bank has nine members - eight women and one man.  They are all responsible parents, with a total of twelve children under their charge.  The members are originally from Sauce, in the north of the country and can be characterised as responsible, hard-working and as people with a desire to move ahead in life.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, they were not able to study and were forced to work from a young age in order to help with household costs.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to prosper, the communal bank's coördinator, Modesta, has a grocery store.  There she sells consumable goods in small quantities - she sells rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, salt, eggs, cheese, creams and soap.  She works some twelve hours a day selling her products.  The objective for this loan is to invest it in working capital and to stock up her business with consumable goods so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a higher income.  The "San Fernando II" communal bank is grateful to Kiva lenders who are providing people with few resources and countries, such as Nicaragua, with the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business with consumable goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, salt, eggs, cheese, creams, and soap.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 51 years old and married with three children.  She is a poultry farmer in Tala town.  She supplies chicken and eggs to the market place as well as to various hotels and restaurants.  She also sells cooking oil. 

Patricia plans to use this loan to buy more poultry to raise and then sell at a profit. She also plans to buy more cooking oil to sell.  She anticipates that she will generate more income, which she will use to pay school fees for her grandchildren.

This is her fifth loan term with KADET LTD.  In the future, she hopes to live a comfortable life as well as to provide her children with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.en:
Ceferino, 59 years old, is a married father of 10 children and lives in Divisoria. A hardworking farmer, Ceferino owns a rice field of less than one hectare and  is requesting a loan of to PHP15,000 to buy five bags of fertilizers for the maintenance and growth of his crops. 


Every harvest season, Ceferino earns an average of PHP15,000 net profit which he uses for the needs of his family. He is hoping that some of his children who are currently attending school will finish their studies and, as a responsible head of the family, he is doing his best in farming to help ensure their future security.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizers for the maintenance and growth of his crops.

loans.name: Vasilika

texts.en:
Vasilika collects plastic and metal scrap, to earn cash. She and her family obtain scrap in two ways:  they either collect the scrap themselves, from the large cities’ garbage bins, or they buy it from local people, like the majority of people in her "Egyptian" community.
 
“We are poor, and we try to make a little income to secure our food. We never stay home. My four school-aged kids, my husband and I work very hard. All day and every day, from early morning until very late evening, we are searching the garbage for [sellable] scrap. Even in this type of activity there is a strong competition because, like us, there are so many families in our Egyptian community that do it. So we have to be on our feet all the time,” Vasilika said.

Vasilika needs this loan to buy metal scrap from locals, which she will sell to the metallurgic complex for processing.

loans.use: to buy metal or plastic scrap from locals, for later resale to a processor

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface runs a spare parts shop in Kangundo town and has been in this business for the past five years. He is 42 years old and married with two children. His wife is a farmer who helps support the family by providing additional income.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more spare parts for selling. These include spare parts for motor vehicles, motorcycle and bicycles. This is his third loan with KADET LTD and he will use the anticipated income to buy more varieties of spare parts.

In the future, Boniface hopes to expand his business and be successful. He also hopes to install electricity in his home.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 56, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlos, a driver, and is a mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca oversees operations of the family's jeepney (see note) transportation business. She has one jeepney unit (14-16 person capacity), which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

Rebecca hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Note: Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 31 years old and married with three children. She supplies building stones and blocks for building houses to various construction sites. She has been in this business for three years and she makes a monthly income of 16,000 Kenya Shillings.

This is her third loan with KADET LTD. She plans to buy stones for making building blocks which she will supply to building sites. She will be able to meet the demands of her customers as well as make more income which she will use to educate her children.

She hopes to expand her business by supplying building blocks, stones and other materials to various construction sites in the area.

loans.use: To buy stones for making building blocks.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 31 years old, married and runs a retail store for an income. She is very patient in attending to her customers' needs, providing them good products and services. She hopes to increase her income so she is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, eggs, breads and soft drinks to sell. This way, she will further expand her merchandise and improve her sales. Maricel hopes to become a better retailer and provide her family with a comfortable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, eggs, breads and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en: Faustino, 40 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. He is also a barangay (Philippine administrative division) captain in his village. He's been in the hog-raising business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 1,500 when he sells one hog. Due to lack of capital, he requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase hog feed, hogs to raise and to sell. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can utilize it immediately in his business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed, hogs to raise and to sell

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es:
Ana, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y nietos. Ella, se dedica a la venta de pollos, toda su familia ayuda en el negocio, esta actividad la realiza para generar ingresos. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar diversidad de pollos, tales como: pollos aliñados, pollos con plumas y pollos tiernos para la crianza, concentrado. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario, las posibilidades de vender más y obtener mayores utilidades.
Su sueño es adquirir incremento en su inventario del negocio, ya que de sus ingresos depende para el sostenimiento de la familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her two children and grandchildren.  She makes a living selling chickens and the whole family helps with the business. She does this work in order to earn an income.  

Ana needs this loan as it will allow her to buy seasoned chickens, chickens with feathers, and tender chickens to raise, and to buy chicken feed.  This investment will help Ana to increase her stock levels, and allow her to sell more and earn higher profits.

Ana's dream is to increase her stock levels as she depends on her income in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seasoned chickens, chickens with feathers, and tender chickens to raise, and to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, él es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad principal es enseñar, él es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal para la educación de sus hijos, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julio Cesar lives in the city of Paucartambo.  He is a hardworking and enterprising person who is providing for his family through the efforts of his work.  His main occupation is teaching.  He is a very responsible person who, for this reason, was invited to participate in the communal bank "Camino al Progreso."  At this time, he needs a loan for personal use to pay for the education of his children.  He appreciates and values this loan, and he promises to be very responsible in making his monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for the education of his children

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es: Maria Luz vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad principal es la venta de jugos y refrescos, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo frutas, azúcar, plantas medicinales, tortas, gelatinas y otras cosas más,  ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: María Luz lives in the city of Paucartambo. She is hard-working and enterprising and is helping her family to prosper through her work.  María makes a living selling juices and soft drinks. She is responsible and so, for this reason, was invited to be a part of the "Camino al Progreso" communal bank. On this occasion she needs a loan in order to buy supplies such as fruits, sugar, medicinal plants, cakes, jellies, and other items.  María is grateful for and knows the value of this loan and promises to be responsible as she makes her repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fruits, sugar, medicinal plants, cakes, jellies, and other items.

loans.name: Floripes

texts.es: Floripes, de 35 años de edad, está casada con Víctor y tiene 03 hijos de 17, 14 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Floripes tiene una salon de belleza y además se dedica a la venta de cosméticos los cuales compra por catalogo y los vende desde su casa personalmente entre sus amistades, en su salon de belleza atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes brindándoles un buen servicio, iniciándose con sus ahorros hace 02 años, realizando sus labores ella sola. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en compra de materiales para implementar su salón de belleza como tintes, líquidos de uñas, champúes y otros.
texts.en:
Floripes is 35 years old and married to Víctor. They have 3 children aged 17, 14 and 12 who all live with them in their house.  Floripes has a beauty salon and also sells cosmetics that she buys from a catalog.  She sells them to her friends from her house.  In her salon, she kindly attends to her clients, providing them with great service.  She started her business 2 years ago with her savings, and does all of the work on her own.  

This is her second loan with KIVA, and she hopes to receive a small loan with which she can meet her goals.  She is committed to making her loan repayments in a timely manner.  With the solicited about of 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase materials for her beauty salon such as hair dyes, nail polishes, shampoos, etc...

loans.use: purchase materials such as hair dyes, nail polish, shampoos, etc...

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José Angel, trabaja como conductor de un bus que hace recorridos escolares y algunas veces cuida vehículos en un parqueo particular, de esta actividades recibe ingresos para gastos familiares y pago de colegiaturas de aranceles escolares de sus 3 hijos de las edades de 16 a 19 años. José está intentando ir mejorando su casa progresivamente gracias al préstamo de KIVA, solicita financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, hierro, arena y perlines para la construcción del muro frontal de su vivienda que actualmente se encuentra desprotegida.
texts.en: Jose Angel works as a school bus driver, and at times he tends to vehicles in a private parking lot. From these activities he receives income for his household expenses and for school tuition and fees for his 3 children, who are between the ages of 16 and 19.  Jose is trying to make gradual improvements to his house, thanks to Kiva loans.  He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, cement blocks, steel, sand, and beams so that he can build a wall in front of his house, which is currently unprotected.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, cement blocks, steel, sand, and beams

loans.name: Vilma Rafaela

texts.es: Doña Vilma de 52 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su madre, su hija y su nieta, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo y embutidos   en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, es una mujer muy trabajadora siembre buscando sacar adelante a su familia y por esta razón que está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y embutidos por mayor para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma, age 52, lives in a family member’s house with her mother, her daughter, and her granddaughter.  She has been selling chicken and sausages for several years at a market that is close to where she lives.

She is a hard-working woman who is always looking to get her family ahead.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy more chickens and sausages wholesale.  She wants to do this in order to continue with her business because this is her only source of work.  This way she will be able to continue giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and sausages wholesale.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Назиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назира занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 30 овец, 1 нетель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Nazira is 34, married, and has three children. She has a high school education and provides the main source of income for her family. She raises livestock, which she began 15 years ago when she bought cattle for 10,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Nazira now earns 10,000 som per month and has thirty sheep, one milk cow, and one heifer. In order to expand her farm, Nazira asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som to purchase cattle for breeding. With the income from the loan, Nazira plans to invest in additional livestock and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cattle for breeding

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella es una persona  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad principal es la enseñanza y trabaja en un colegio popular, ella es una persona responsable que por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Camino al Progreso” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para pagar un curso de especialización, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes lives in the city of Paucartambo.  She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who strives to get her family ahead with the work ethic.  Her primary activity is teaching, and she works in a public school.  She is a responsible person which is why she was invited to join the "Camino al Progreso" communal bank.

Given this opportunity, she is seeking a loan to pay for a specialization course.  She is very grateful for and appreciates the loan, and is committed to responsibly adhering to the monthly loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: pay for a specialization course

loans.name: Bun Lestari Group

texts.en:
Bun Lestari Group is renewing their relationship with MUK.

To increase the price they get for their pigs, the group changed the method of maintaining the pigs. Some members still maintain sows, and the other members raise either super-quality pigs for fattening or local pigs for pork roll. With this method, the initial sales of baby piglets will remain within this group, only. The members who have sows, will sell their baby piglets to other members of the group, who raise the pigs for fattening or for pork roll. Later, the fattening or pork roll pig-raisers will sell to the big buyer.

Ni Wayan chose to maintain fattening pigs, and she is using her share of this loan to purchase piglets and feed. She hopes this new method will work, so she and the Bun Lestari Group will get satisfactory results.

loans.use: to buy piglets for fattening, and feed

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman, who has been blessed with five children. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg, 42 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a noodle house for two years and quickly secured permanent customers due to the good location of her noodle house. 

Her husband renders taxi service to local people.Their daughter studies at the university and during her free time, she helps her mother at the noodle house. Their younger child, who is five years old, goes to kindergarten. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of uncooked noodles from her suppliers. As a result, she will continue to run her noodle house without worrying about inventory shortage. She is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of uncooked noodles.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
This is Marietta, 52, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, an employee, and she is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household, while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marietta runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out,” from a stack or heap of anything. In this case, Marietta is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in urban poor communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are very much cheaper, when compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her stall is located in an urban poor public market, Marietta's business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in net sales, every day. 

To help her expand the business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, used bags, and footwear. If she can roll the profits from this loan back into the business, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Marietta dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional used-but-quality clothes to sell

loans.name: Kanymbu

texts.ru: Канымбу 42 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Канымбу - среднее образование, работает в местной школе-буфетчицей. Канымбу в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Канымбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 15 овец, 14 коз, ежемесячный доход составляет 6,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канымбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки овец. Доходы от кредита Канымбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадьбы старшего сына.
texts.en: Kanymbu is 42 years old, a widow and raising three children by herself after the death of her husband and also running her own business.  Kanymbu has a secondary education. She works at a local school cafeteria.  To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 24 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 2,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Kanymbu's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 calf, 15 sheep and 14 goats.  The monthly income amounts to 6,500 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Kanymbu requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase livestock headcount by buying sheep.  Kanymbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and plans to save money to hold a wedding for her oldest son.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ryslygay

texts.ru: Рыслыгай 59 лет, разведена. У Рыслыгай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рыслыгай занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рыслыгай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыслыгай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку сена для скота. Доходы от кредита Рыслыгай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Ryslygay is 59 years old, divorced.  Ryslygay has a secondary education.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 5 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 25,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Ryslygay's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and 1 calf.  The monthly income amounts to 4,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Ryslygay requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy hay for livestock.  Ryslygay plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy hay for livestock

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Progreso está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas personas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal en sus ratos libres le gusta disfruta de la compañia de sus hijos y prepárales comida típica de la región como “buñuelos” lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. 
Gracia a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal El Progreso es Blanca y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como  arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergente, huevos, fósforos, cloro, tiste, tortillas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para que en un futuro no muy lejano  pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  El progreso agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Progreso is made up of nine members; eight women and one man. All are responsible mothers and fathers with a total of 15 children to care for. They are originally from Sauce, located in the northern part of the country. They are known for being hard working, responsible, and with the desire to succeed. In their free time they enjoy the company of their children and preparing traditional foods such as "buñuelos." Unfortunately, due to economic circumstances, they have been obliged to work from an early age. 
Thanks to their efforts and their desire to make a better life, Blanca, the coordinator for the communal bank El Progreso, decided to work with them. She runs a grocery store where she sells products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, matches, cleaners, a regional drink called tiste and tortillas. She spends 12 hours a day working in her store. The goal of this loan is to invest more working capital into her business and to stock her store so that in the near future she can have higher profits. The communal bank El Progreso thanks all those lenders at Kiva who help others with little resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a chance at a dignified life.

loans.use: stock their business with rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, eggs, matches, cleaners, the beverage tiste, and tortillas.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is 40 years old, married with three children, and from the village of Divisoria. He is a tenant managing a one-hectare corn field. He used to hire farm laborers when he planted and harvested corn; however, because of financial difficulties, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to pay labor costs and to buy farm supplies to sustain and pursue his farming well. His wife, on the other hand, is selling fruits for daily immediate needs. Alejandro dreams to see his family in the future in good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
This is Vicenta. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed grocery items for her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her children and she is very thankful because of that. Her income from the business is helping her family with their daily expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vicenta dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gulfara

texts.ru: Гульфаре 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом имеют 1 сына. Сын - женат. У Гульфары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульфара занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульфары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 лошади,12 овец, а также имеет 3,92 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульфара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на сбор урожая. Доходы от кредита Гульфара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение внука.
texts.en: Gulfara is 52 years old, married and has one son with her husband.  Their son is married.  Gulfara has a secondary education.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 18 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulfara's hard work, today her business contains 3 horses, 12 sheep and also 3.92 hectares of land, where she annually grows beans and potatoes.  The monthly income amounts to 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Gulfara requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to gather her harvest.  Gulfara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and plans to save money to continue educating her grandson.

loans.use: to gather her harvest

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 47 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гульнары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гульнара занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulnara is 47 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband.  Gulnara has a secondary education.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Gulnara's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 calf and 10 sheep.  The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Gulnara requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a dairy cow.  Gulnara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: David

texts.en: For almost 20 years, David has been into farming activities, and every harvest he is earning an income providing for the basic needs of his family. Now, he wants to extend his horizons in farming for the future of his family. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to buy five bags of fertilizer for farm use. Being a responsible father to his children, he strives hard for the betterment of his family, especially in providing for the education of his children. David is now 57 years of age and he is a responsible husband and father to his family, living in the village of Divisoria.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Don Fernando vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 17 y 9 años de edad,  desde hace varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para adquirir buenos cultivos siembra maíz y frijol, tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, almacena sus cosechas en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para tenerlos listos cuando los clientes lo busquen, Don Fernando esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de  herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para seguir cultivando y así obtener buenas ganancias y seguirle dando a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 17 and 9 years of age.  He’s worked in agriculture for several years now and he’s gained the necessary experience to obtain good crops of corn and beans.
