He has a large clientele that prefers him for the quality of his products and the good prices.  He stores his harvest in the silos shown in the photo to have them ready for when customers come calling.  

Fernando’s asking for a loan to buy herbicide, fertilizer, manure, seed, etc. to continue planting thus earning higher profits and to continue providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to continue buying mobile recharge cards.

loans.name: Heronimo

texts.en: Heronimo, a father of three children, is now 38 years of age and lives happily with his family in Barangay Divisoria. He has been a farmer for 10 years, and every harvest season he is able to get just enough income to provide for the basic needs of his family. He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farming business. He wants to see his children in comfortable living conditions in the future. Having this loan will someday pave the way to attaining this goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Habel

texts.en:
Habel is a 55-year-old man, and married to Selfiana, a 49-year-old woman. They have 7 children, namely: Arianto, 25, is working as an Ojek (motorcycle taxi driver); Sriyanti, 19, fresh graduated from senior high school; Andri, 18, and Titin, 17, are both senior high school students; Ongki, 15, and Yuniati, 11, are elementary school students and the last one is Marfin, 4. 

To finance his family's needs, Habel runs a business selling gasoline. He has been running this business for years. He started this business by using his own capital of IDR 1,500,000 to buy 1 drum of gasoline, 1 drum of diesel fuel and 1 drum of kerosene and send them to Rote Island. The average income he generated from this business amounted to about IDR 150,000 – 250,000 per day. 

In order to earn more income, he also works as a laborer at a port near his house. He intends to improve his business. Due to lacking enough money to do so, he has requested an individual loan from TLM of IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be spent on more gasoline and kerosene. He hopes the improvement of this business will enable him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline and kerosene.

loans.name: Elfete

texts.en:
Elfete is 52 years old, married, and living in the Ashkali community in the southern part of Kosovo with her daughter and son who are 21 and 25 years old. Based on family tradition, Elfete works in agriculture, although the main source of income comes from her son who is working as a guard in a private company. Elfete owns cows to provide for her family's needs, which allows her to be able to save the money that she would normally spend on milk and other dairy products.

Now, for the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to buy another cow and to renovate her stable since it has been a long time since she was last able to fix it. The loan will help them to improve their living conditions, because increasing the number of cows and taking care of their surroundings will enable her family to have more milk and milk products. She wants to thank all of the lenders and is very appreciative for the help.

loans.use: To buy another cow and to renovate her stable.

loans.name: Margarito Obdulio

texts.es:
Don  Margarito tiene 70 años de edad, ha procreado cuatro hijos, entre las edades de 20 y 27 años de edad. Es una persona humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y sorgo aprendió esta labor desde muy pequeño, recuerda que su padre le compro una Cuma para llevarlo y enseñarle a limpiar la milpa madrugando y trabajando todo el día, no tenia oportunidad de estudiar hasta que cumplió 14 años lo mandaron a la escuela y aprendió a leer y a escribir, logro sacar 1° grado. Luego, que decidió formar su propia familia se ha dedicado a cultivar granos básicos y hace 10 años decidió comprar una vaca parida con la cual poco a poco a aumentado el número de animales que ha logrado ir desarrollando para y así ir subsistiendo y cubrir otras necesidades. Ahora en día él ha enseñado a sus hijos a cultivar para que en el futuro puedan desarrollar habilidades de trabajo y desarrollen otras habilidades.

El cliente se dedica a criar terneras en desarrollo comprándolas pequeñas y vendiéndolas cuando ya están cargadas, tiene aproximadamente 10 años de haber iniciado esta labor, aparte de eso se dedica a cultivar maíz, frijol y sorgo de los cuales obtiene residuos de cosecha que le sirven como alimentación a sus animales en época seca, él tiene el apoyo de sus dos hijos que son los que le ayudan con sus labores agrícolas y a cuidar los animales.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de terneras que desarrollara para que el próximo año  tenerlas destinadas a la producción de leche o para venderlas cargadas y producir ganancias que solventaran algunas necesidades de su familia.

En el futuro don Margarito, piensa tener las puertas abiertas para sacar otro crédito después de cancelado este, si es necesario, además pretende dedicarse solamente a la crianza de terneras (ampliar su negocio) y dejar que sus hijos desarrollen las actividades agrícolas para cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Margarito, 70, has had four children whose ages range between 20 and 27 years.  He’s a humble, hardworking man who works growing corn, beans and sorghum having learned to do so when still very little.  He remembers that his father bought him a machete to take him along and teach him how to weed the cornfield; he’d get up at dawn and work all day.  He didn’t get the opportunity to attend school until the age of 14 when he was sent to school.  He learned to read and write and completed first grade.

Later when he decided to form his own family he’s worked growing basic grains and ten years ago decided to buy a gravid cow to gradually increase the number of animals and he’s managed to develop to subsist and cover other needs.  Today, he’s taught his children to farm so that in future they will be able to develop work skills and develop other skills.

The client works raising calves; he buys them small and sells them already pregnant.  He’s been doing this work for about 10 years now.  In addition to this, he works growing corn and sorghum from which he gets crop discards that serve as animal feed during the dry season.  His two children help him with the agricultural chores and to care for the animals.

The loan will be used to buy calves to raise during the next year; they will be destined to milk production or to sell pregnant and to yield profits to cover some of his family’s needs.

In future, Margarito intends to keep the doors open to another loan once this one is paid off, if necessary.  He also intends to work exclusively raising calves (expand the business) and to let his children carry out the agricultural activities to cover the family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy some calves.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha esta separada del esposo, vive con sus hijos en casa propia de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de fruta en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz, ambulando todos los dias vendiendo frutas de temporada las cuales las comercializa en diferentes lugares tanto en pensiones y snaks.Necesita credito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y poder comprar más fruta para ofrecerla a sus clientes 

El sueño de Martha  es tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa
texts.en:
Martha is separated from her husband and lives in La Paz.

She sells fruit in the southern part of the city, walking every day selling seasonal fruit in different places.  She needs this loan to buy more fruit to offer her customers.

Martha's dream is to have a convenience store in her home.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene  49 años y vive junto a su esposa Zulma y sus 4 hijos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Es profesor en la primaria de su localidad, pero al ver muchas oportunidades económicas en su entorno decidió tener otro negocio. Hace  2 años conoció a dos amigos quienes al tener las mismas ideas de superación optaron por poner un negocio dedicado a la fabricación de muebles a base de madera. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener buenos ingresos y tiene como ventaja poder obtener los bloques de madera a buen precio los cuales son traídas por agricultores de la zona desde zonas reforestadas. Su principal objetivo a largo plazo es ampliar su catalogo de productos e iniciarse en la fabricación de ataúdes y demás muebles con el que es posible obtener buenos ingresos. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará bloques de madera para la elaboración de los muebles.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 49 years old and lives together with his wife Zulma and their four children in his house built from adobe. He is a teacher in the town primary school, but upon seeing the many economic opportunities around him, he decided to start another business. 

Two years ago he met two friends. As they had similar ideas of succeeding, they chose to start a business making furniture from wood. As time has passed, he has been able to make good money. He has the advantage of being able to obtain blocks of wood at a good price. They are brought by local farmers from reforested areas. 

His main long-term objective is to expand his catalog of products and to begin making coffins and other pieces, with which he can make good profits. This is his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial help he receives in order to keep moving forward. He also commits to making his payments punctually. 

With the 1000 PEN he will buy blocks of wood for making furniture.

loans.use: to buy blocks of wood

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 53 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Luis, con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Maria se dedica a la siembra de granadilla, además tiene una pequeña tienda de comestibles en donde vende comida, bebidas, dulces, pasteles variados y la granadilla que ella misma siembra. Ya tiene 5 años dedicándose a este negocio, le va muy bien pues es una mujer perseverante, ya que tiene que cuidar con mucho esmero sus sembríos de granadilla, “la venta de granadilla es mi principal ingreso pues comercializo al por mayor entre los comerciantes que llegan de todas partes del país, pues mi casa se ubica en la misma carretera, además soy la única que siembra esta fruta, ya que mis tierras son propicias para ello”, menciona. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. María, invertirá los S/.1500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de granadilla.
texts.en:
María, age 53, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband Luis.  They have four children, but only one still lives with them in their own home.  María grows “granadilla” (a fruit that is native to the Andes) and also has a small grocery store where she sells food, beverages, sweets, various pastries, and the “granadilla” that she grows.  She has been in business for five years and is doing very well because she is a persevering woman.  María looks after her “granadilla” crop with great care.  She says, “Selling this fruit is my main source of income.  I sell my product wholesale to merchants who arrive from all parts of the country since my house is located along the highway.  In addition, I am the only one planting this fruit since I have land of my own.”  

This is her second Kiva loan.  She is grateful for the financial support that she needs to continue forward.  In addition, she promises to submit her loan payments in a punctual manner.  María will invest 1,500 PEN in the purchase of organic fertilizer that she needs to nourish her “granadilla” crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Pavle

texts.en:
Pavle is a married man with 5 adult children, living in a minority community. Although 4 of his children are married, they all live in the same village in the southern part of Kosovo where he lives with his wife and 1 daughter, who is single. Based on tradition, Pavle has always worked in agriculture while his wife stays home to care for the house and the family’s needs. In order to earn a living, he works on his land with a tractor, growing and harvesting sunflowers. 

Typically he sells the products in the community, but now Pavle needs a loan to buy a machine to assist with the planting. The loan will help him to continue his business, and to cut the expense of hiring others to help him plant and harvest. His goal is to save the money for his future and to have better living conditions for his family. Pavle wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a machine to assist with the planting.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 30 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmela is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmela has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from direct selling beauty products. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yanjinlkham

texts.en:
Mrs. Yanjinlkham, 39 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been running a tailoring shop for eight years and take orders from retailers. Their daughter goes to high school. 

The workshop where they work has been deteriorating and some of the sewing machines are broken, so Yanjinlkham is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase building materials and sewing machine spare parts. Using those building materials, her husband will renovate their workshop and repair their sewing machines with the spare parts. It will result in work efficiency and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and sewing machine spare parts to renovate the deteriorating workshop and repair the sewing machines.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz.

Trabaja como zapatero desde muy pequeño, con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia ya que la esposa trabaja como lavandera en domicilios particulares, en ocasiones, porque quien solventa todos los gastos de la casa es él, el credito que solicita es para reparar una habitacion en su casa y darle comodidad a sus hijos

El sueño de Apolinar es darle una profesion a sus hijos y que no tengan que trabajar como el
texts.en:
Apolinar is married and has five children.  He lives at his parents’ house in the city of La Paz.  

Apolinar has been working as a shoemaker from a very young age.  Through this trade, he has been able to support his family.  His wife works on occasion as a laundress at private residences because they need to cover all of the household expenses.  The loan he is requesting will be used to repair a room in his house so that his children can be comfortable.  

Apolinar dreams of providing a profession for his children since they are without work.

loans.use: to repair a room in his house.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor trabaja como contador en una empresa de transporte, con lo que gana debe cubrir sus necesidades básicas y apoyar a su madre económicamente, la señora vive con él en un domicilio alquilado en la ciudad de El Alto en el que también los dos hijos de Victor. Necesita crédito para comprar una computadora portatil puesto que el equipo le puede servir tanto en la oficina como en el hogar
texts.en:
Victor works as an accountant for a transportation company. He says he has to cover his basic expenses and support his mother with the money he earns. Victor’s mother lives with him and Victor’s two children in a rented room in the city of El Alto. 

Victor is requesting this loan to buy a laptop computer to use in both his office and at home.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive con sus 2 hijos en la ciudad de La Paz, se encuentra separado de su pareja pero tiene la custodia de sus 2 hijos. Juan se dedica al lavado de Automóviles llegando a realizar este servicio 10 ó 12 vehículos hasta el medio día. Juan  necesita el crédito para poder refaccionar su vivienda y poder brindar a sus hijos un mejor lugar para poder vivir ya que el lugar donde viven es una casa que heredaron varios hermanos y a Juan le corresponde una superficie de 4 mts. por 9 mts.

El sueño de Juan es poder brindar a sus hijos el sustento y educación suficiente para que puedan ejercer una profesión subsistir en un ambiente cada vez más competitivo y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his two children in the city of La Paz.  He is separated from his partner, but he has custody of his two children.  Juan works at a car wash where he provides his services to 10 to 12 vehicles before noon.  He needs this loan so that he can repair his home and provide his children a better place to live.  Juan inherited the house along with his brothers and he occupies a space that measures 4 x 9 meters.  

Juan’s dream is to provide his children with sustenance and sufficient education so that they can pursue a profession that will help them survive in a high competitive environment and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is now 43 years old. He is married, with two children, and lives in Divisoria together with his whole family. His business is farming and he has been into this for almost 15 years. During the last cropping season he got Php 20,000 net income. He used this to support some of the needs of the family and some was utilized to pay debts. 

He wants to expand his farming area to earn double income in the future. That is why he wanted to have a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers for his crop maintenance. Eventually, when his yield is gradually improving, he will then able to save for his farming goal that he dedicates to his family's future welfare.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizers for his crop maintenance.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luís, de 55 años de edad, está casado con Ami quien es madre de sus hijos. Juntos habitan la casa de sus padres en compañía de su papá, hermana, dos sobrinos, y su abuela. Luís se dedica al transporte de pasajeros para eso cuenta con un mototaxi el cual compró con su propio capital hace 05 años, recorrelas calles de la ciudad buscando a sus clientes y llevándolos a su destino de manera segura. Le gusta su actividad pues le brinda los ingresos necesarios para seguir adelante. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte en la ciudad y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles comprará repuestos para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, así como el pago del servicio a un mecánico.
texts.en:
Luis, who is 55 years old, is married to Ami, who is the mother of his children. They live together in his parents' house together with his father, sister, two nephews and grandmother. Luis works transporting passengers. He uses a motorcycle taxi for this, which he bought 5 years ago with his own capital. He drives through the streets of the city looking for customers and taking them safely to their destination. He likes his occupation because it provides him with the income needed to get ahead. He considers his business to be quite profitable because of the demand for transportation in the city and the good profit that it provides to him. 

This is his first loan with Kiva, therefore he is hoping for your contribution in order to continue with his goals. In addition, he promises to make his payments punctually. With the amount of 2000 nuevos soles that he is seeking, he will buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle taxi, as well as pay for the services of a mechanic.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay for a mechanic.

loans.name: Telnith

texts.es: Telnith, de 43 años, está casada con Rodolfo de 44 años y tiene dos hijos de 18  y 03 años de edad respectivamente, tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su familia. Telnith se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y accesorios por catálogo, tiene un local en  el interior de su vivienda, desde este lugar atiende muy cordialmente a sus clientes que son sus vecinos y familiares. Lleva trabajando seis años y lo hace sola pues cree que así está mejor. Se inicio  en es este negocio por falta de ingresos económicos y le gusta su trabajo ya que tiene disponibilidad para muchas otras actividades además de tener ese contacto directo con la gente ya que es muy sociable y siempre está trayendo ropa de buena calidad. Este es el quinto crédito con Kiva, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1600 soles, comprará cosméticos para damas, ropa, entre otros.
texts.en:
Telnith, 43, is married to Rodolfo, 44, and they have two children who are 18 and 3 years of age respectively.  She owns a house where she lives with her family.  

Telnith works selling cosmetics, clothes and accessories.  She has a locale inside her house where she cordially tends to her customers who are her neighbors and family members.  She’s been working for six years and does it alone because she believes it’s better this way.

She started the business because of the lack of income and she likes her work because she has time available for many other activities.  Also, she enjoys having direct contact with people because she’s very sociable and always brings good quality clothes.

This is her 5th Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel confident about making business progress this way.  On the other hand, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested 1,600 soles to buy women’s cosmetics and clothes, among others.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Zongolica2 Group

texts.en:
Bernando, Merced, and Catarina live in Tlaxcantitla, a remote indigenous community located in the mountainous sierra of Zongolica, in the state of Veracruz.  The region is very complicated in terms of land, and they do not have access to electricity even though the community has asked the local authorities for support.  Specifically, Bernardo's group depends on candles, and sometimes ocote (pine resin), for lighting.

This is Bernardo's story:

Bernardo is a 48-year-old man that lives in the community of Tlaxcantitla, described above.  He supports a family of 4 mainly by cultivating corn, and sometimes by selling firewood to the community.  Bernardo's house has no access to electricity, so the family relies on other lighting sources such as candles and ocote, which are not very powerful or efficient.
 
For this family, education is very important, and a solar home system will allow Bernardo's kids to increase the time they can use for academic activities at night. 
 Additionally, Bernardo needs to be more productive to increase the family income, which now is about $25 USD on a productive week, and create a better life for himself and his family.  A solar home system will allow him to achieve this goal.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to improve his productivity.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Салтанат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Салтанат занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салтанат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Saltanat is 23 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband.  Saltanat has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 5 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Saltanat's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 bull and 20 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 6,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Saltanat requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy sheep for increasing livestock headcount. Saltanat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and plans to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy sheep for increasing livestock headcount

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 76 years old and widowed with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, canned goods, milk, soaps, sugar, etc..

Carmelina has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Carmelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoos, canned goods, milk, soaps, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to acquire a solar home system and bring positive change in their local community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to extend his productive hours per day and spend more quality time with his family.

loans.name: Estrella Marie

texts.en:
This is Estrella Marie, 31, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Percival, an employee, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Estrella Marie operates a doormat business. Her products are small rugs and larger doormats. She buys a large quantity of doormats and then sells them. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought; sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She directly sells her products to her neighbors and the local community. 

She also has a direct selling business for additional income. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of doormats. 

Estrella dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more doormats to sell in her doormat business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, meat, chicken, sausages, soft drinks, eggs, pastries, and more for her grocery store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old.  He is married and the father of five children.  He operates a metal shop in Mpeketoni, Lamu town, and he has been in the business for the last six years. He earns a monthly profit of KES 13,800. 

Paul was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and now he is applying for his fifth loan of KES 50,000.  He intends to use the loan to add tools and equipment needed for his business.  Paul plans to save the anticipated profit and take care of his family while also growing his business. 

In future, Paul hopes to grow his metal shop with a view of expanding it into a fully equipped car garage.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools needed for his metal shop

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto is engaged in the transportation business, specifically motorcycle transport.  He has been running this kind of business for 30 years.   He also cultivates more than one hectare of rice. 

Income from his transportation and farming goes toward his family's daily consumption, maintenance of the rice field, and daily allowances of his three children.

Loreto would like to take out a loan of PHP 10,000, which he plans to use for repair of his motorcycle sidecar. He hopes that his requested loan amount will be granted, so he can continue to improve his transportation business and earn better profits.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle sidecar

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos uno de ellos estudia actualmente, ella poseen una panaderia desde hace 10 años, sus ventas son muy buenas, es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, educada y su familia es muy unida, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus  gastos, la clienta solicita un crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de materia prima como harina, huevos, levadura, latas, etc. Para poder continuar elaborando pan, y así poder incrementar su nivel de ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her husband and their two children, one of which is currently in school.  She has had a bakery for 10 years and her sales are very good.  She is hardworking, responsible, and educated.  Her family is very close.  Through her work, she has been able to cover some of her expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials such as flour, eggs, yeast, cans, etc.  In this way, she can continue to make bread, increase her sales, and improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as flour, eggs, yeast, cans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo, ella posee una tienda desde hace de 2 años ubicad en su lugar de residencia, es una persona responsable, honesta, y muy amable a la hora de atender a sus clientes, lo que la ha llevado a ganarse su confianza, gracias a su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, la clienta solicita un  crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como Lácteos, sopas, granos básicos, golosinas, etc. para poder ofrecerles algo nuevo a sus clientes, aumentar su nivel de ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her husband and their son.  She has had a store for 2 years which is located where she lives.  She is responsible, honest, and very friendly when it comes to assisting her customers.  This has allowed her to gain their trust.  Thanks to her work and the support of her husband, she has been able to cover many of her family's expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise such as dairy products, soup, basic grains, sweets, and other things.  In this way, she will be able to offer her customers something new, increase her sales, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise such as dairy products, soup, basic grains, sweets, and other things for her store

loans.name: Aguacatal Group

texts.en:
Teresita, Jesús and América form a group of three neighbors that live in Aguacatal, Campeche.  Aguacatal is a community of immigrants who re-located to this region to find better opportunities, however they do not have adequate services in their community.  Teresita, Jesús and América each represent a family and are interested in acquiring a solar home system on credit.  

Teresita is 40 years old and lives with her husband and her two grandsons in a little household that has been in her family for four generations.  During her childhood, her father introduced Teresita into the family business of lemon harvesting.  Now Teresita and her husband are the ones in charge of running the family business.  Fortunately the income they earn from selling lemons is enough for the maintenance of her household and her family, but still Teresita hasn't been able to get access to the electric grid.  A friend of hers allows them to use her electric hanging wires to get light during night, but Teresita knows this is a dangerous act and doesn’t want her husband or either of her grandsons to get hurt when they need light.  That's why Teresita dreams about purchasing a solar home system with her life savings to help her family.  By doing this, her beloved family members can stop risking their lives every time they need light during the nighttime.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system and improve their families' quality of life.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 36 years old, happily married, and blessed with two children.  Her husband is a trruck driver. 

Marissa has run her variety store and a direct-selling business for six years.   She plans to buy stocks of merchandise and some products for her direct-selling business, but because of insufficient funds, she is seeking a loan of PHP 7,000.

She hopes to obtain the loan amount she requested,so she can maintain good income and sales.  In this way, she can let her two children finish their studies and give them a better way of life someday.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her variety store  and products for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Claude Christine

texts.fr: claude est une femme de 37 ans qui vit en concubinage avec son conjoint et mère de 2 enfants.elle  a 5 ans d’expérience professionnelle dans la coiffure.le succès de cette activité vient du fait d'une clientèle essentiellement constituée des femmes de plus en plus passionnée par la beauté et les produits cosmétiques de ce fait, cette  activité semble répondre  aux besoins de ces clients qui en demandent un peu plus. aussi le crédit qui est accordé à claude lui permettra d'acheter des marchandises: des mèches ce qui lui permettre de d'augmenter ses bénéfices, promouvoir son activité et d'envoyer ses enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
Claude is 37 years old and lives with her partner in a non-marital relationship.  She is the mother of two children.  She has five years of professional experience working in a beauty salon.  The success of her business is due to the fact that the great majority of her customers are women who are passionate about beauty and cosmetics.  As these customers typically request a bit more (than just hair cutting), Claude seems to be meeting their needs.

Claude will use her loan to buy products such as hair extensions, which will allow her to increase her profits, develop her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as hair extensions.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old. He lives in a small village in the Lanchkhuti district with his parents and grandmother. His grandmother has a retirement pension. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have milk cows and a plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. George works hard to insure a good harvest. George always has high-quality products, which are sold at a good price at local markets. 

As the income is only seasonal and not enough for a family of four, George decided to start a business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions.

The start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. George's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of GEL 4,000.

George plans to open a food market. He will purchase a stock of a wide assortment of products to offer his clients. George hopes that the business will be successful as the place becomes very crowded. 

The new business initiative will significantly increase the income of his family, and with increased income, they will be able to expand the business in future as well as improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a food market

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.en:
Bernabe has been engaged in the transportation business, specifically in motorcycle transport.   He has run his business for two years. 

Bernabe’s wife is an overseas Filipino worker (OFW).   Meanwhile, he has four children. One of his children is still studying; two others are laborers, and one child is still an infant.

Bernabe aspires to have a better way of life, to let his children finish their studies, and to keep his transportation business profitable. 

For him to obtain his goal in life, he is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000, which will be use to buy new wheels and to invest in his fish-vending business. He hopes that his transportation business will grow continuously for him to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to buy new wheels for his motorcycle and to invest in his fish-vending business

loans.name: Ericka De Los Angeles

texts.es: Ericka, habita en un barrio pobre de Managua, actualmente trabaja como técnico evaluador para una institución del estado, su hijo de 9 años cursa la escuela primaria. Ericka solicita financiamiento para la construcción de una habitación debido a que en su casa se encuentran asignados en un solo cuarto. Con el financiamiento comprará materiales de construcción como cemento, bloques, hierro y arena, para iniciar la obra progresivamente. Como sus ingresos mensuales son muy bajos no puede invertir de una sola vez, por tanto lo hará en etapas.
texts.en: Ericka lives in a poor neighborhood in Managua and currently works as a technical evaluator for a government body. Her nine-year-old son is in primary school. Ericka is requesting a loan to build a room because she and her son live in a single room. She will use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, cinder blocks, rebar, and sand to begin the first phase of the project. Because her salary is very low, she is unable to complete the construction all at once, so she will do it in stages.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, rebar, and sand.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael, a 54-year-old married father of five children, lives in Kangundo where he has been buying and selling cattle for 26 years. He earns  a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya Shillings. 


Having repaid his previous loans, Raphael is requesting his third with KADET LTD to buy more cattle to later sell at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of his family.


Raphael hopes to invest in a variety of businesses and become a successful entrepreneur to better provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old and runs a private school in Nairobi's Thika road area. She has been operating it for the past three years. She is a single parent, with two children.

Beatrice plans to use this loan, which is her third from KADET LTD, to buy iron sheets and build another school. She anticipates admitting more children, and with the anticipated income, she will expand and secure her school by building dormitories to make it a boarding school.

Beatrice's future hope and dream is to empower her community by creating employment and thereby eradicating poverty.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets for building another school.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca, de 30 años, está casada con Jilder con quien tiene 03 hijos de 14, 10 y 05 años de edad respectivamente. Blanca se dedica a la venta de pescado, por eso desde muy temprano va en busca de pescado fresco al mercado de su ciudad, de ahí lleva sus productos hasta la casa del padre de su esposo y como es una zona muy concurrida, coloca los pescados en el frontis de la casa y espera a que los clientes lleguen en busca de pescado fresco y bueno; como acostumbra vender. Lleva realizando este trabajo por un año aproximadamente, hace su trabajo sola ya que su pareja trabaja en otro departamento del Perú desde donde le manda alguna ayuda económica. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo para poder estar en su casa haciendo otras actividades, además todos los días hay buenos ingresos ya que tiene buenas ganancias, espera poder mantenerse y quizá más adelante poner una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindan de poder aumentar su capital de trabajo ya que así le genera mayor ganancia. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará pescado fresco además comprará algunas bandejas y materiales para poder vender mas cómoda y no tener que utilizar las cosas de los padres de su conviviente.
texts.en: Blanca, 30 years old, is married to Jilder, with whom she has three children 14, 10, and 5 years old. Blanca sells fish, so she goes out to the local market very early to look for fresh fish, which she takes back to her father-in-law's house. Because the house is in a busy area of town, she sets up the fish in front of the house and waits for customers to come to buy high-quality fresh fish. She has been doing this work for about a year and works on her own since her husband works in another region of Peru and sends money back home to support the household. She likes her work because it gives her time to be at home doing other things. It also offers her a good income, and she hopes to be able to support herself and perhaps in the future set up a grocery store in her house. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the opportunity it provides to increase her working capital and generate higher earnings. She will use the requested loan of 1000 soles to buy fresh fish, as well as some trays and other materials so she can sell more comfortably and not have to use items belonging to her husband's parents.

loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Desederia

texts.en:
Desederia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, fish, etc., for her restaurant.

Desederia has been in this business for 28 years.  She earns other income from a general store.

Desederia has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like vegetables, spices, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Solomon, a driver and father to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen owns and oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business (see footnote). She has a one-unit jeepney (14-16 person capacity), which runs at full capacity each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be use the loan to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney unit.

Helen dreams of having additional units of jeepney, and she hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. Jeeps were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and the Jeep was modified into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 40 years old and married, with one child.

He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  He is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Eduardo has been raising pigs for six years and also earns income from rice retailing.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save enough to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Llanqac  Illary Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Llanqac Illary” en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Marleny tiene 43 años de edad y es padre y madre de sus dos hijos, (En la fotografía la socia está levantando la mano). 

Marleny es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar,  fideos, leche y otras cosas más, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, fideos y otros más.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la elaboración de artesanía, tejidos, joyas y otras se dedican a la venta de cosméticos y a brindar servicio de transportes.
   
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the Llanqac Illary village bank in the city of Cusco.
Marleny is 43 years old and has two children. (In the photo, she is raising her hand.)
Marleny is very charismatic and friendly and works hard to get ahead. Her main source of income is her work selling staple goods such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, and other products. She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise to sell.
This village bank is made up of a number of people who are always seeking opportunities to better their lives and offer a brighter future to their children. The members work making crafts, woven fabrics, and jewelry, and others sell cosmetics and offer transport services.
The members are all grateful for the opportunity they’ve been given and are committed to making their various payments as established by the loan terms.

loans.use: to buy staple goods such as rice, sugar, pasta, and other products.

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS”  iniciará el segunda ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras, ayudante de albañil, comerciante de ropa, artesanía en manta de alpaca, venta de verduras, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas y chompas, tienda de barrio, servicio de amplificación.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace catorce años y en la actualidad mejoró su técnica.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The Flor de Rosas village bank is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office. The group has nine members, and Lucia is the president of the board of directors. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of ways, including making skirts, working as an assistant bricklayer, making alpaca blankets, selling vegetables and fruits, weaving blankets and sweaters, running a neighborhood shop, and offering amplification services.
This loan will help these microentrepreneurs. Lucia notes that she has had two loans with Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of the institution's promoter, who visited her in her home. She currently has a business sewing skirts, which she says she started fourteen years ago and has continued to improve her skills.
She will use this loan to buy fabrics at the markets in the city of La Paz and then use them to make skirts at her customers’ request. This work allows her to bring in an income to support her family, since she is married and has five children.
When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the business training it offers.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Playa Verde Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLAYA VERDE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sancrestina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carnicería, producción de mantas y polleras, tienda de bario, tejido de awayos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sancrestina es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción que realizó la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio y elaboración de polleras; ambos negocio los trabaja en su domicilio lo que es una gran ventaja para la educación de sus hijos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital del trabajo en pollerería (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el bajo interés.
texts.en:
The Playa Verde village bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada regional office. The group has eight members, and Sancrestina is the secretary of the board of directors. The members' businesses are quite varied and include a butcher shop, a business making blankets and skirts, a neighborhood store, and a business weaving traditional Bolivian blankets.

This loan will help these microentrepreneurs. Sancrestina notes that she has had three loans with Pro Mujer, which she joined because of the publicity campaign the institution carried out in her area. She currently has a neighborhood store and makes skirts. She runs both businesses out of her home, which gives her a big advantage in educating her children.
 
This loan will increase her working capital and allow her to buy fabrics from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then use them to fill her customers' orders. This business helps her bring in an income to support her family, since she is married and has five children.

When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the low interest rate.

loans.use: buy fabric.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a cash-crop farmer in Kangundo town, where he plants maize and beans for selling.  He is 44 years old and married, with four children. Besides farming, he also has a retail shop. His wife also provides income for the support of the family.

Justus plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs for planting. These include fertilizer and seeds. He will also use part of the loan to buy more stock of retail items for his shop. These include sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, and bars of soap. 

This is his third loan term with KADET LTD, and he will use the anticipated income to educate his children by paying their school fees.

He hopes to be successful in his business and thereby be able to provide good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Accesorios Clemente Group

texts.es: El grupo Accesorios Clemente es un grupo familiar viven en una comunidad pequeña, pero muy tranquila sus habitantes se dedican al cultivo de maíz tienen sus tradiciones muy arraigadas están orgullosos de ser gente mazahua, los tres integrantes hablan muy bien su lengua materna y también el español. Don Jesús es el representante del grupo él tiene 28 años de edad vive en unión libre con la señora Josefina desde hace 10 años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños dos de ellos van a la escuela. Don Jesús y Doña Josefina tienen negocio familiar de accesorios de autos donde venden focos de colores, estampas, aromatizantes para autos, volantes, micas, tapetes, etc. y Doña Hilaria invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes. Esta vez Don Jesús y  Doña Josefina están solicitando el crédito para comprar más productos que le hacen falta como cables para instalaciones de sus alarmas Don Jesús nos platica: “Anteriormente no sabía cómo se realizaba la instalación de las alarmas sin embargo estoy tomando clases para aprender y sacar adelante mi negocio el reto para mí es no saber cómo manejar mi negocio, lo inicie porque mi papá se dedicaba a esto”. Don Jesús apenas tiene tres años con su negocio. La meta de Don Jesús es hacer crecer su negocio pero también le gustaría que en un futuro pudiera abrir un nuevo negocio cerca de su casa, porque en donde tiene actualmente su negocio de accesorios solo es prestado y tiene que estar pagando mensualmente la renta y es un gasto para su familia que obligatoriamente tiene que hacer. Le gustaría recibir un curso de cómo manejar su negocio, poco a poco va adquiriendo conocimientos por su propia experiencia pero le encantaría tener educación más formal.
texts.en:
The "Accesorios Clemente" group communal bank is a family group who live in a small but very quiet community. It's inhabitants grow corn, are very rooted in their traditions and proud to be Mazahua people. All three members speak their mother tongue as well as Spanish. Jesús is the representative of the group. He is 28 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with Josefina. They have been together for ten years and have three children, two of which go to school. Jesús and Josefina have a family business selling auto accessories such as colored lights, stickers, deodorizers, steering wheels, side lights, carpets etc. Hilaria will invest her part in her grocery store.

This time Jesús and Josefina are requesting a loan to buy more products, things they do not have, like cables for installing alarm systems, Jesús told us: "Before we had no idea how to install alarms, but now I am taking courses to learn and get my business ahead. The challenge for me is that I don't know how to manage the business. I started it because it was what my father used to do". Jesús has been in the business just three years. 

The goal for Jesús is to expand his business but also in the future he would like to open another business close to his house. The current location of his business is on loan to him. He has to pay rent each month and it is an obligation his family has to keep. He would like to take a course in managing his business. He is learning little by little through experience, but he would love to have more formal training.

loans.use: to buy automobile accessories.

location.town: San Lucas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Téko

texts.fr: Téko pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille fabrique et vend des savons à domicile. Il est aidé par 01 personne et sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des matières premières entrant dans la fabrication du savon. Il espère améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille( Marié et père de 04 enfants tous des majeurs) et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: In order to provide for his family, Téko produces and sells soap, from his home.  One person helps him run the business, and this is his second loan with WAGES.  This loan will help him to buy the necessary ingredients to make soap.  Téko hopes to improve his family's living conditions (he is married and the father of four adult children).  He would also like to achieve sustainability in his business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make soap.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 43 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. Erma works very hard to provide for them.

Erma runs a general store in the Philippines  She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc..

Erma has been in this business for five years.

In the future Erma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda es una mujer de 31 años de edad que desde muy temprana edad aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura, conocimientos que fueron traspasados por sus padres quienes han sido agricultores desde toda una vida siendo su especialidad la producción de café. La tierra que hoy en día junto a su esposo trabajan la han adquirido por herencia y otra parte comprada con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio en la cual tiene sembrado café catimora y lempira. Ella es madre de 4 de los cuales 2 están en la escuela teniendo un grado de educación primaria incompleta ella no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. En compañía de su esposo trabajan mancomunada mente y mientras llega la temporada de corta para vender el grano ella también se dedica a la venta de chinería en la zona donde ella habita siendo sus clientes las diferentes personas que habitan en la comunidad de los distintos productos que ella vende.

Sus planes para el futuro es poder mejorar sus cultivos, hacer crecer más su plantación y seguir adquiriendo tierras ya que de ser posible ella piensa en el bienestar de sus hijos y lo que hoy en día hace es fortalecer el patrimonio que un día los vera crecer a ellos y a las demás generaciones. Por eso hoy en día solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara fertilizantes, abono, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. con lo que podrá dar asistencia y asegurar sus cultivos para la próxima temporada.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 31 year old woman who learned farm work from a young age.  She was passed this knowledge by her parents who were farmers who specialized in coffee production.  The land that she works today with her husband was inherited, and another part was purchased with great effort and sacrifice.  They plant coffee of the Catimora and Lempira varieties.  She is the mother of four children, two of whom are in school.  She started a year of primary school but was not able to finish since her parents lacked the financial support to let her continue.  She and her husband work together and once the cutting season to sell the grains comes, she also works selling low-cost products in the area where she lives.  Her customers are the different people who live in the community of the different products that she sells.  

Her future plans are to improve her crops, make her farm grow, and continue acquiring land since she is always thinking about the well-being of her children.  What she is doing today is strengthening the legacy that one day will grow for them and future generations.  In order to do this, she is requesting a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to purchase fertilizer, manure, coffee formula, fungicides, and other items.  This will help her and assure that her crops are ready for the next season.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: marthe est une jeune femme âgé de 24 ans célibataire et sans enfant à charge. elle 7 ans d’expérience dans cette activité. son succès dans cette activité  provient de la demande de service à laquelle elle fait face. avec  ce crédit, elle pourra acheter une  nouvelle photocopieuse nécessaire pour pérenniser son activité,  accroître  son chiffre d'affaire et sa condition de vie.
texts.en: Marthe, age 24, is a young single woman with no children in her care.  She has seven years of experience in her job. The success of her business is due to the demand for the type of services that she provides.  With her loan, she will be able to buy a new photocopier.  This purchase has become necessary to make her business sustainable, increase her turnover and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, and iron.

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es: Doña Aydalina tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de nacatamales y cosa de horno, actividad que le ha permitido subsistir y darle educación a su hijo. El crédito solicitado será para compra de materia prima (maíz, queso, aceite, leña, verduras y azúcar) para la elaboración de los productos que ofrece, y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Aydalina is 57 years old.  She is a single mother with one school aged child.  She works making and selling nacatamales and corn cakes.  This work has allowed her to survive and give her son an education.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients (corn, cheese, oil, firewood, vegetables, and sugar) to make the products that she offers so that she can increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase corn, meat, cheese, oil, firewood, vegetables, and sugar.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.es: Doña Arcadia se encuentra muy feliz ya que con su primera solicitud de crédito ella pudo comprar los insumos para sus cultivos de papa con la que obtuvo una buena producción de su cultivo y pudo salir con su compromiso de crédito. Las ganancias fueron obtenidas para re invertir en sus cultivos una parte y la otra fue destinada para un semillero de papa certificado el cual pudo obtener esta vez para poder cultivar. Su producción fue muy buena y pudo obtener ganancias aproximadamente 50 QQ de papa de muy buena calidad pudiendo vendarla rápida mente a un precio accesible y considerable en el mercado local. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados hasta tal punto que sobrepasaron sus expectativas. Por lo que esta vez han decidido solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual puedan sembrar la semilla que actualmente tienen en una mayor cantidad y poder preparar la tierra nuevamente para el nuevo producto ya que es necesario por el mantenimiento y protección de la misma para poder sacar buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Arcadia is very pleased with how her first loan went. With it, she was able to buy the supplies she needed for growing potatoes, obtaining a good harvest from her crops and enabling her to fulfill her loan commitment. She used her earnings in part to reinvest in her crops on one hand, and the rest, she sent to a certified seed potato nursery, which she will plant from this time around. 

Her production was very good and she was able to earn income on around 50 quintales (about 100 lbs per quintal) of high-quality potatoes. She was able to sell them in the local market quickly at a price that was both accessible and considerable. Her business changed for the better thanks to the first loan, as did her quality of life. The income she earned met and even possibly exceeded her expectations.

That's why this time she has decided to request a second loan, which she will use to plant the seed that she currently has, but in larger quantity, and once again prepare her land for the new product. Doing this is necessary to preserve and maintain the excellent results that she has had.

loans.use: plant certified seed potatoes

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 29 years old and married, with one child.  He lives in Divisoria. He is a very responsible father. He is a father who is working hard for the future of his family. 

With farming, he manages to support his family's needs. He also earns an extra income for other needs as a laborer. 

In order to improve his farm production, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for his farm. Having a sufficient supply of farm inputs will provide proper growth and maintenance of his crops, leading to better yields.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and insecticides for his farm

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy (in the photo) is 28 years old and lives about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2007, and she has two children, one son and one daughter.   

Thavy is a tailor who specializes in making robes for monks, while her husband is a soldier. She is asking for a loan to build a concrete room under her open-air house.

loans.use: To build a concrete room under her open-air house.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus supplies charcoal in Tala town, and she has been in this business for seven years. She also sells in retail to her customers. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. Her husband also provides income to support the family.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell. This will be her fourth loan term, having repaid all her previous loans successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of her family.

She hopes to be successful in her business and thereby to be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 35 años, está casado con Margarita y tiene dos hijos de 09 y 04 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Carlos  tiene como trabajo dos actividades diferentes, el primero consiste en el transporte de pasajeros dentro y fuera de la ciudad en su mototaxi, además tambien se dedica a la venta de pescado, por las mañanas se va al puerto a comprar y vende por las diferentes calles de la ciudad, lleva realizando este trabajo por 08 años y lo hace solo en algunos momentos y cuando necesita personal contrata temporalmente a algunos trabajadores. Le gustan ambas actividades, pues siempre trabajó ligado al comercio y le gusta mucho estar en constante movimiento. Este será su segundo préstamo con Kiva, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi ya que se esta deteriorando el sistema de arrastre y el circuito eléctrico, además comprará pescado para seguir con su venta.
texts.en:
Carlos, 35 years old, is married to Margarita, and together they have two children, aged 9 and 4, and they all live together in their own home. Carlos has two lines of work. The first consists of carrying passengers inside and outside the city in his motorcycle taxi. Besides that, he also sells fish. In the morning, he goes to the port to buy and sell fish throughout various streets in the city. He's been doing this work for 8 years, and while he mostly works alone, when he needs extra help, he will hire temporary workers. He enjoys both his jobs, as he always has been connected to commerce and he really likes being in constant motion.

This will be his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the financial support that he has received to help him keep moving ahead. He is committed to paying his loan back on time. With the S/.1000 soles that he is requesting, he will purchase spare parts for his motorcycle taxi as the brake system and the electrical circuits are beginning to deteriorate, and he will also purchase fish at wholesale to continue with his sales business.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi and fish for resale

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson does carpentry in Nairobi town, where he makes wooden tables, chairs, and beds. He is 37 years old and married, with four children. He also supports his parents. He has been in this business for two years.

This being his first loan term with KADET LTD, he plans to use the loan to buy more wood for use in his workshop. This will enable him make more chairs, tables, and beds and thereby satisfy his customers' needs, as well as make more profits that he will use to open another carpentry shop.

Wilson hopes to grow his business and be successful, so as to provide good living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy wood for use in his workshop.

loans.name: Benicia

texts.es:
Doña Benicia tiene 32 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos, agricultora y ama de casa como también comerciante ya que es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual atiende diariamente ante las diferentes personas que llegan por la adquisición de cosas básicas para el consumo de sus hogares. En compañía de su esposo trabajan para el bienestar de su familia ya que son ellos los únicos involucrados en el trabajo de la tierra en el mantenimiento de frijol y papa ubicado siembras que están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde ella habita. La propiedad fue heredada por medio de sus padres y con unos años de experiencia en compañía de su esposo dan el mantenimiento necesario para que sus cultivos estén sanos y protegidos de bichos entre otros. 

Sus planes y metas a futuro es poder cultivar una mayor producción la cual mejore sus ingresos para el bienestar y el futuro de sus hijos ya que ella planea sembrar una mayor variedad de hortalizas ´para poder vender a sus vecinos, amigos entre otros que visitan su negocio diariamente como también a los compradores o intermediarios que llegan a la zona. Es por ello que ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara e inyectara capital en sus cultivos en la adquisición de insumos como: coliflor, abono, curion, cionter, brócoli, manzate, entre otros para cultivar y dar asistencia a los mismos.
texts.en:
Ms. Benicia is 32 years old. In addition to being the mother of four children, she is also a farmer, a homemaker, and a business woman. She runs a small convenience store out of her home where she works every day. Her customers are people who come to pick up basic supplies for their home use. She, along with her husband, work for the well being of their family now that they are the only ones involved in working their land. They use the land to grow beans and potatoes; these crops are located on the same property where they live. She inherited the land through her parents and with a few years of experience, she and her husband have been able to give it the care it needs to keep it free of bugs, among other things.

Their plans and goals for the future are to grow greater production, which will improve both their income as well as the well being and future of their children. She plans to plant a variety of vegetables which she will sell to friends and neighbors and other customers at her store, as well as larger purchasers and middlemen that come to the area. She is requesting this financing through the COMIXMUL cooperative, which she will use to inject capital into her farming by acquiring fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and other supplies for growing cauliflower, broccoli, and others new crops.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies and plant new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is married with four children who attend school.  She lives in her own house with electricity but not piped water.  Saum has operated a beauty salon for the past two years.  Her potential customers are women.  She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

With the 30,000 KES loan she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.  She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: La Palma Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Palma” está conformado por nueve mujeres y un joven, todos ellos son muy trabajadores, pero sobretodo lo que los caracteriza es su alegría. Entre ellos se respira una gran confraternidad. Doña Angelina o Ange, como le llaman, tiene 44 años de edad está casada desde hace 27 años con el señor Jorge juntos han formado una familia con cuatro niños de los cuales tres aun dependen de dicha pareja y dos de ellos están estudiando. Doña Ange tiene una florería desde hace ya nueve años platica que la idea fue de ella, inicio rentando un local vendiendo solo flores naturales y con el tiempo decidió tomar un curso para hacer arreglos. “Me encanta ver como se ven las flores decoradas o combinadas, si de por sí las flores son muy bonitas, aún más en conjunto”. El negocio de doña Ange iba muy bien y poco a poco su esposo también se interesó en esta actividad así que le enseñó todo lo que ella sabía y ahora cada uno tiene su florería independiente. Al parecer no presentan ninguna dificultad y sus florerías tienen éxito en cada una de sus temporadas. Las flores las compran en otro municipio donde consigue un precio más barato para aumentar un poquito más su ganancias. “Mi única meta es ver realizados a mis hijos profesionalmente, yo y mi esposo nos esforzaremos para poder solventar todos los gastos de su educación”. Los integrantes del grupo son Ángeles, Blanca Estela, ellas están solicitando el crédito para invertir en la cría de borregos, Adriana en estambres y cosméticos, Emma en venta de tortillas, Kevin en la cría de pollos, Milagros en la venta de ropa, Carmen en ropa para bebe,  Emma R. en bueyes y Norma en su mobiliario para su renta.
texts.en: The group “La Palma” consists of nine women and a young man. All of them are very hard-working, but above all they can be characterized by their happiness. Among them exists a great network of support. Angelina, or Ange as they call her, is 44 years old, married for 27 years to Jorge. Together they have a family with four children, three of whom are still dependent upon them and two are still in school. Ange has had a flower shop for nine years and says that the idea was hers. She began it by renting a locale, selling only natural flowers and with time she decided to take a class in flower arranging. "I enjoy seeing how flowers can be decorated and combined; if the flowers are very pretty by themselves, they are even more so as an arrangement." Ange's business is going very well and little by little her husband also is becoming more interested in this business so she has taught him everything she knows and now each of them has an independent flower shop. They aren't having any difficulties and their flower shops are successful in each of their seasons. They buy the flowers in another town where they get a cheaper price in order to increase a little more their profits. "My only goal is to see my children become professionals; my spouse and I inspire each other to be able to pay all the expenses of the children's education."  The members of the group are Angeles, Blanca Estela, they are seeking a loan in order to invest in growing yearling sheep, Adriana wool and cosmetics, Emma sells tortillas, Kevin raises chickens, Milagros sells clothing, Carmen baby clothing, Emma R. steers and Norma rents furniture.

loans.use: to buy flowers to sell.

loans.name: Channang

texts.en:
Channang is single, lives with her parents, sister and brother on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Channang is a silk weaver. She hopes to continue her weaving business because it’s a traditional profession business, and she asks for a loan to buy raw silk.  
Photo: Channang and her loom.

loans.use: to buy raw silk.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 58 years old and married with four children.  Ofelia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan, through NWTF, to buy more stock to sell.  Items include canned goods, milk, noodles, soft drinks, eggs, spices, and soap.

Ofelia has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transportation.  Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 41 years old.  She lives with her son in the small village of Marneuli district.  Anna has 2 pigs and a plot of agricultural land, where sunflowers are grown.  She sells the harvested sunflower locally at a good price.  As the income is only seasonal, and not enough to cover everyday costs, Anna decided to get a loan for a business.  But the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers.  Anna’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements.  

She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  This is a start-up program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of $4,000, Anna will purchase a car and start trading fruits and vegetables.  Her son will be a driver and will help her to generate income.
